reviews.review: Worth to visit. Wonderful place with wonderful architecture. Food (snacks and boiled corn) are available. Square is equipped with underground lavatory.
nice square. Surronded by the Blue Mosque , Hagia Sophia and near other attractions , this square is a good place to take a seat ,rest a little bit and maybe have a simit or corn...
nice. very pleasant place to visit although tide security with many armed police and military personnel patrol around.
Big square. A big square(long but not very wide) placed in the old town.Very interesting as long as it's surrounded by famous landmarks like Blue Mosque or Aya Sofia.
peaceful. a great and peaceful square with many tourist attractions.Some days I would rather seat and eat boiled corn and watch passersby.

Family Free Time. Sultanahmet Square is the perfect place for couples as well as for individuals but it is the ideal family place where parents can watch and interact with their children in a secure safe environment. There is always this busy but exciting vibe and it is absolutely perfect every day of the week.
Beautiful. Beyond all imagination. Like you were in the centre of the civilization or everywhere in the world at the same time. Unique.
Iconic place. Half of world history happen here. Iconic place. Half of world history happen here. Four main attraction to visit. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Basilica Cisterna.
A lovely open space.. This is the central area between all the famous places to see. It's been designed and planted very well and you can sit and watch the world go by. A very pleasant area.

square between blue mosque and hagia sophia. if you go blue mosque or hagia sophia you see sultanahmet square too.
it is between of blue mosque and hagia sophia
it is good place for rest after review of blue mosque.

Take in the view. You must visit the Square when in Istanbul. Sit and watch the world go by. Near tram stops so can visit from other areas. Amazing view of The Blue Mosque. Feel the buzz of the city day or night. Not to be missed!
best historical area. ı have been there many tıme and when ı go there ı feel lıke old time ,there is have many historical place ,different culture place,than there is so nicely area also ın istanbul
soltan ahmad. A beautiful place with easy accessing. you can get there with tramva or taxi.near to great bazzar of Istanbul.

Beautiful views wherever you turn. This is the square smack in between Aya Sofia and the Blue mosque. Although packed with locals, tourists and street vendors, you can easily pull out a book and lose yourself in its serenity. Look ahead across the gardens and see the ancient grandeur of the great Aya Sofia; turn around and be greeted by the bluish-grey minarets and domes of the exquisite Blue Mosque. Under a deep blue sky, surrounded by children running in the grass, dogs sleepily resting in the shade of palm trees and happy picnicking families, this place makes you thankful to be alive.
FUN FUN FUN. very beautiful place and must visit if you are in Istanbul. Had very good time visiting . It like time travelling
must. its imposibble to skip sultanahmet while you are in istanbul, ofcourse we took lots of pictures, just awesome and fun

Magnificent . Loveeeed itSo peaceful and vibrant at the same timeMany great things to doU can visit : the blue mosque, the hippodrome, Hagia Sophia , Topkapi palace is near only a few minutes down the street , Gulhane park is near too.U can even take the Gulhane tram to eminunu district where u can do a variety of things there too or you can just walk your feet around.
Amazing place . Currently in istanbul and this is our favourite spot. Peaceful yet bustling. Perfect evening spot. Always full of people and so clean.

Great place to observe both the Blue mosque and Hagia Sofia. Sit on one of the benches on the square and admire the beauty of The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia on either sides. Great spot to take photographs.

Best View, Beware of Scammers. This is definitely the best place to appreciate the beauty of both the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. Since this is a touristy area, be careful of locals suddenly talking to you in straight english asking you to come with them for a drink.

Majestic Area. A very beautiful and historic location; but sadly it was empty of any tourist activities! I was very depressed to see the whole square is not filled with tourists! I was there during the first 3 weeks of September for a business trip; and at no time, I felt unsafe!
Go there and enjoy your vacation!!!!
Very nice. It was amazing square with some nice garden and fountains. There were some places where you can have some food you can get.

Beautiful. There are many surrounding around Sultanahmet Square such as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topgapi Palace, Hippodrome, Constantine Column, etc. I stayed around the Sultanahmet old city, it's very close the square so every day I had to walk pass the Sultanahmet Square. Apparently, there are a plenty of colorful tulips in April. It's definitely interesting to sit and look around people here.
Central location for sites, street food and shopping.. A must visit as it is in the center of major sites. Lots to eat, drink and buy as well. There are lots and lots of tourists, so have patience.

Beautiful but wish visitors would respect it more.. To be overlooking two beautiful mosques this place is bustling and calming at the same time. Plenty of visitors taking photos, being by the fountains. Particularly pretty at night when the fountains light up in different colours.However it was so sad to see the state some people left it in. It was more Turks than foreign visitors too. Rubbish left strewn about from picnics making the place look unkempt - it was a sorry sight. It was busier because of Eid and maybe some bins have been removed after recent events in the square, but there should be more signs to tell people to take their rubbish with them or impose a fine if caught!

Central to almost "everything". The Sultanahmet district is the heart of historic old Istanbul and the, most visited of tourist places, and for good reason.Sultanahmet Square is central to so many sites including the Basilica Cistern, the Hippodrome, Sultanahmet Mosque (Sultanahmet Camii-Blue Mosque), Topkapı Palace, Hagia Sophia and museum (Aya Sofya) and much more.With glorious garden surrounds, seating and nearby cafés and restaurants, you can spend days here, to see it all.
Nice place. Best place to visit if you are in Istanbul. This place is having Blue mosque , Hagia Sophia Mosque , Water Storage , Bazars and restaurants .

Scenic and Serene. The square provides views to the Blue Mosque and Sophia Hagia Museum. There were a lot of people sitting in the square enjoying the scene. It was walking distance from my hotel so quite convenient. Beware of the guys hanging around that befriend you by asking where you are from and sharing some tip. Their goal is to escort you to there shop so that they can get you to purchase overpriced jewelry.
Grandiose. A must see for anyone. Ages of ages cultures all mixed beautifully. Energy in the area gets the person high. I suggest for anyone sit on a bench, close your eyes and listen to your hearth.
A fantastic place. This is where you get to sit down and soak in the atmosphere of the square. Full of tourists wathing you and you watching them. People watching is a great fun activity
One of the nice ancient place in Istanbul. One of the nice ancient place in Istanbul, you will find nice architecture, you should visit it, if you go to Istanbul
Beautiful area. Lots of shops and coffee place near that area. You can find a coffee shops that overlook the mosque (at the root) also called The terrace.Beautiful view

A beautiful and relaxing location.. But. It's location allows for beautiful pictures and a relaxing break. It does become crowded with limited seatings. Smoking is very annoying with a lot of young and reckless visitors around the grounds. The fountain has a nice light show at night. You will most likely pass through the square if you visit Sultanahmet, do stop to enjoy it for few minutes, perhaps 15 will do.
So full of life. This place is always full of tourists. You can sit and enjoy Cay and ice cream and enjoy the view of great historical sights.

evening hangout. Lots to see in the square and views of the hagia sofia and the blue mosque, public toilets that are clean (most are in turkey), ATM machines, street food (try a simmet) and the remains of the hippodrome with the obelisks. Big fountain and greenery and benches to rest. Lots of families here in the evening milling around, picnics on the grass and watching the people strole by
Beautiful central point. A lovely place to relax a while after walking round attractions the fountain is lovely great for photos and as an anchor point Nice street cafes not to badly priced

Culture overdose. Very historical area, full of culture and character. A must see when visiting Istanbul. Next to Hagia Sophia, there is the Ottaman Palace, the Blue mosque, Yerebatan underground city, German fountain, the Grand Bazaar and several other museums. All in walking distance. The area is full of hotels (for every budget), restaurants, bakeries. If you have time plan at least two full days to cover the important bits. But you can easily spend a few days more if you are into history and culture. I have been there several times, and every time I find something else to see. A trip down to eminonu is recommended. You can easily walk, it is down hill and about 500m.

Love this area of Istanbul, day or night.. Love staying in this area. So much to see and get to in the Sultanahmet area. The view of the the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia are great from here. This is also the place to get hooked up with a Bosphorus cruise and enjoy a simit while people watching.
Photos Galore. This part is the perfect spot for clicking photographs. You won't be able to stop yourself from cliking. It's wonderful, beautiful place, active and full of life.
Standard stop on any visit to Istanbul. Great photo opportunities in this square. Historic sights and monuments are everywhere. A must see and well worth it.
Amazing. Although is very touristic this part of Istanbul is absolutely amazing! With its rich history, beautiful signs an buildings and lovely flowers it is a place you must visit!

Great Place to chill between sightseing. This big paved area located between few Sightseeing such as H. Sofia, Blue mosque, basilica Cisterns, and many other.
It nice place, even though prices of food there is on the high end.
Kids loved feeding the pigeons.
Stop by and take brake and few photo.
C U Around.

Dull and empty of crowds. Istanbul's problems have emptied much of the city of its usual crowds of 'western' tourists who seem to have been replaced by many visitors from the Middle East. This was never much of a tourist attraction and is even less so these days.

Absolutely fascinating. We were fascinated by this area and site , and there were no crowds, primarily because of the down turn in tourism,sadly but this is a good thing for the traveler who wishes to brave it, fantastic. I and never been to turkey before and was impressed, the people were so accommodating and helpful. This is one city I could spend more time in , just wonderful.

The best square in town. Every time I come to Istanbul I make time to visit this great square. I sit in front of Agia Sofia and admire its greatness. It is really "grande". It is funny to see how quickly the clouds in the sky behind the church change their shape. The voice of the muezzin , heard from time to time, travels your mind back in time and clears it from all the problems of the present. I find it very rejuvenating.

Wonderful landscape square for photography.. What I can say about this area is that it is a wonderful landscape square for photography. You do not need to be a professional photographer to make your memorial picture looks good because the area will help you. I am sure that most of the Istanbul visitors puts there pictures in this square as there profile foe many applications.

Beware of touts. Of course any tourist must come here. The views and monuments are beautiful, especially at sun down. However, be very mindful of touts, they are just so hectic. You may think local people are trying to be friendly, but for sure, they are trying to sell you carpets, guide services, or other services. Beware pick pockets too. There is definitely a strong police presence in the square these days following the terror attack, but this is a good thing. Avoid the cafes and juice shops in the square, prices are an absurd rip off. If its hot and you are really hungry, get a corn cob for TL 2 at one of the many stalls and a bottle of water and then go take a meal and drink over near the Sultanahmet tram stop where prices are normal. Do go up on one of the many restaurant rooftop terraces at sundown to see the monuments from that angle too.
Beautiful Gardens. This is in the area of the Blue Mosque and is a beautiful stroll between the Blue Mosque and the Sultans Palace.
impressive view to Istanbul. When you stand on the square, you can see beautiful view to Ayasofya and Sultanahmet Camii (Blue Mosque) - the scale and historic location

I could spend all day and night here. This is where I spent most of my time here in Istanbul. It's just a great atmosphere. There's plenty of people chilling, you got the beautiful fountain, stray animals chilling as well, and of course...the 2 beautiful mosque's on opposite ends. It's just a nice place to relax and people watch.

You'll never be lonely.. Everyone heads to Sultanahmet. You will be befriended by several or many new friends who want to share their knowledge of the area with you. Everyone is friendly and polite and everyone is trying to make a living.

Bustling with life. This area is quite touristy being in the middle of the major attractions. You will find locals selling you souvenirs and food. I didn't spend too much time here, only to pass through to get to our hotel.

Place of joy and peace. Sultanahmet Square is one or the most wonderful and beautiful places to visit in Istanbul. You can go through history and enjoy the beauty of nature, peaceful place, exquisite food and shopping, cultural interaction. Love to visit this place every time I go to Istanbul.
Great views of Blue Mosque and Santa Sofia. You will need to walk across it to get from the blue mosque to santa Sofia or the palace. It is certainly worth a few pictures. Next to the hippodrome.

Sultanahmet - Istanbul. When I have a few hours to take my friends and my customers somewhere in Istanbul I always go to Sultanahmet Square.
There You see in a glance the transition between two cultures, two historic periods and two cultures.
There You get how close and how far We are.
That is the entrance door to Istanbul

Great place to sit and hangout.. The sultanahmet square is the heart of old Istanbul, teeming with life, vendors selling chestnuts and tour guides haggling with prices for various trips. Take some time to sit and sip on a cup of coffee and have the freshly roasted chestnuts and absorb in the sunlight. A beautiful place to spend a couple of hours.

sultanahmed square in istanbul. its a historical place in ancient istanbul
it has a monument in it
i suggest to take a look to sultanahmet mosque too

Relaxing walk thru. During our stay in Istanbul, we walk thru several times thru sultanahmmet square, sitting on its benches & enjoying time. It is like as one walks thru the history, with all the historical landmarks around you.
Wonderful square. This is well designed and offers a nice view of the surrounding sites. Be sure to try the corn vendors!
Good place to relax. This is in center of Sultanahmet area from where you can see all major attractions. It is a big square where you can sit and relax

Multicultural city. Take time out to just sit in the Sultanahmet Square and see the splender and beauty of the magnificant historical structure around you and watch the cosmopolitan residence. Try the local
stall holders selling sweet corn, water melon, soups freshly baked baggles etc. Cheap and delicious.

An oasis of peace. Soldiers and police were very low profile in the area and there was no sign of the recent turbulent events. Tourists were few so we had the square all to ourselves but this only helped in the peacefulness we experienced here. The perfect place to take in the scenery and to relax on the benches all around the square.

A beautiful place to walk and kill time. So much to see here. It's a beautiful place to go for a walk or even just to kill time. You have so many beautiful mosques and museums such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia Museum, Topkapi palace etc
Lot to discover. By just walking throw this Square you feel you are in a living 18th century district. It is very good also for a night walk with an icecream.

Great location to sit with the Blue Mosque on one side, Hagia Sophia on the other. Thoroughly enjoyed sitting here, in every direction there was something to see. The fountain between the two great sights is the perfect location to sit and enjoy people watching. Filled with street vendors, locals and tourists and within view of two great structures, this park like setting is the perfect place to spend some time.

Beautiful green space in the middle of history. This little oasis of green amid the history of Sultanahmet is an excellent spot to pause in the sun and enjoy some people watching from all over the world. I often wish I lived closer so I could relax there with a cool drink after work and watch almost literally the world go by while surrounded by buildings that still give me a thrill every time I look upon them.
Nice. it is a near to sultaahmet plalace nice square to see. it is a fantastic historical edifice that is full of old civilization and Islamic history.

People watching central. This is a great place to hang out for a while and watch people. The space is perfect for refreshing oneself with treats from food vendors and relaxing between visits to nearby Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace.
NICE PLACE TO VISIT. The masjid and surrounding areas are worth visiting, to appreciate the work and architecture, and to take some picures.
nice square. it is a nice square near to sultaahmet plalace to see and take photos and may be sit in a cafe and enjoy
exploration visit to old history. it was the second visit to this place, it is a fantastic historical edifice that is full of old civilization and Islamic history and othmanian achievement
Interesting. Best time to see the square is in the evening, it's cooler and the Mosque and the fountain is lit up.

Wonderful history and architecture. This is a very peaceful and restful site surrounded by some of the busiest areas of Istanbul. It is amazing place to marvel at the fantastic architecture and reflect on an important part of Turkey's history.

congrats to municipality of fatih.... sultanhmet square is the name given to the vast area of; saint sophia, blue mosque, underground cistern, a historical ottoman bath plus similar. public transport is via street car. there is no entrance fee!.. clean, fresh and tidy.

Plenty to see for free. I spent several hours today walking around the square, the views of both Hagia Sophia and the blue mosque are magnificent. There is plenty of seating, much in the shade, with food and craft vendors aplenty. Tours of the blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, the cistern ruins, and Turkish baths are all easily accessible, and passes allowing access to all are available. Even on a warm day, there was plenty of wind and shade making it a very comfortable place to sit and relax.

Spectacular view and buzzing of tourists; Muhteşem manzarası ve turistlerin uğultu. This meeting place is always busy and buzzing with tourists. The view of the surrounding area is spectacular. Turkish shops with traditional cuisine are not far away and many shops are selling goods. It brought me lots of smiles.

Lovely fountain and Square. Perfect views on either side, of the blue mosque and Hagia Sophia. Enjoy a donor kebab whilst watching the crowds go by. Take in the moment at sunset, and watch the beautiful structures light up.
A must to go when you visit Istanbul. a Garden surrounded by the Museum of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, where there are citizens who take a walk, read a book, socialize, and also sells food ..

Massive but nothing special. Just a big square, really. Bunch of overpriced tourist restaurants and street vendors, couple mosques that lack colors on exterior, and thats it. It gets better overnight when fountain gets lightened up and so do mosques.
Nice square. Nice square. You can go there by tanva via taksim square. When you are going there with travel you can see a lot of beautiful old Istanbul around

Exceptional Square. What a beautiful, awe-inspiring square! Colorful flowers, trees and water features, with paver stone walkways. The beauty of nature, with man's majestic Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque at opposing ends. Ample seating to contemplate all of the architectural marvels. Many of Istanbul's main attractions lie on or near this Square. Note: Unless you are in the market for a lovely carpet, be wary of the friendly rug promoters, who encourage you to go with them and visit their family's rug shops.

Just Go Already!. Istanbul is a charming city and this area is a great place to be. There are little shops everywhere, food vendors, and the best part, so much to see! Don't miss going into the mosque while you're here, but be prepared to cover up. If you don't have anything to cover up with, no worries, they will provide you with borrowed items to use. Just return them once you leave the mosque. This is a great area, so just go already!

Excellent place near the Bosphorus. It carries the history. If you are a history lover or a lover of architecture, you must visit the place. It is also called the Blue Mosque. So far i know, it is the only mosjid in the world having six nos. minar.
Location!. If you are a tourist, sooner of later you will arrive to this place. Then you will find it's charm due the location.

Sultanahmet Square. Stunning view, very picturesque. We just found it whilst wandering around on our first day, which I find are when the greatest discoveries are made! I highly recommend going along, it's worthy of a few pictures to take home!
Mosque with Social activity around. Lots of activity in the square with fun, food and great atmosphere. Great for a walk and spend evenings after dinner.
Pretty place. Nice square with great atmosphere. In the evening especially is better when the lights are shining and a lot of people walking around there.

The Most Picturesque View in Istanbul. Any corner of this square you sit, you are surrounded by a minimum of 3 tourist attractions. Can't get better than this! Chilling at the square with some fresh corn (Misir) or roasted water chestnuts live is divine.

Worth an early morning visit. Although usually filled with tourists and their cameras, no trip to Istanbul can overlook this magnificent spot. Magical at twilight it can be seen possible;ly at its best early in the morning before the tourists arrive.
Beautiful gardens. This is a great area for a quick stop and refresh. The gardens are beautiful. A lot people picnic there. Nice scenery.

Nice place to walk. Nice place to walk and visit several monuments and also the ancient part of the city. It's interesting to go to the top of one building (several restaurants have it) to see the view over Istambul.

Excellent location. Must visit. When you stand in Sultanahmet square and you look around and enjoy the site of two of the world's most majestic monuments : The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia Cathedral you must feel the awsomness of it all. What a feeling!
Anytime . This place is anytime busy mainly with tourists. Trum or train run through Sultanahmet Square which makes visiting this place more easier.
The Middle of the Historical Part of Istanbul.. You can easily spend your entire day there watching people, enjoying the New and Old together, enjoying the magnificent buildings on both sides.

Day or night quite a view. If you have nothing to do at night, just sit and enjoy the fountain and the peaceful scenery munching on a con of roasted corn, or Turkish simit bread which are available every where.

Love the fountains. Opposite the Blue Mosque this area is great of relaxing with some spectacular fountains and colour lighting at night. Plenty of seating too and some shaded areas under trees. Not far to a good selections of places to eat as well.
Must see. Many attractions are in this historical square. At least one day to know everything in here. Enjoy your visit!

Sultanahmet Square. The most visited tourist spot.
Crowded at all times, but not to be missed.
Recommend to visit it by tram which is the cheapest & best mode of transportation when in Istanbul

Great place to just sit and observe. One of the best squares - find a spot to sit and enjoy some pomegranate juice or apple tea and just enjoy. We were here on the last night of Ramadan and it was packed. If you go during the holiday, dress modestly - I was wearing modest shorts and felt quite uncomfortable and out of place. Great place to be during call to prayer as both mosques have a call - and they are like dualing calls to prayer.

Nice place to sit and people watch. Our hotel was located right next to the square so I was out here after dinner almost every night. The lighted fountain is a draw for kids and adults alike...and it is full of life at night. If you are sitting there especially by yourself, be careful of the hustlers who pretend to be a tourist and your friend..and try to lure you to go drinking with you.

Lovely view of both mosques. The square covers the space between the Blue and Haga Sophia mosques, and give beautiful views of both. The fountain on the square is impressive, and it is worth spending some time here just to take it all in.

Beautiful and picturesque place. This square is colourful with all greenery and fountains. Gives a panoramic view of Blue mosque and hagia sofia.
Evenings are romantic.

Dont miss it. Always lots going on whatever the time of day or night. Great atmosphere and so many places to eat and drink. Find the little alleyways at the side closest to sea, great views of blue mosquestions in evening when it's floodlit

Lovely place. This is a lovely place to go for a walk and have an ice cream or an orange juice. I went many times just to admire the amazing view. Also I have lunch in a restaurant near the square, very good kebabs.
Heart of town. This is the heart of the historical town, with views to the most famous landmarks, and some nice cafes and restaurants nearby...Nice place to stroll!

turistic and crowded. yes it's an important place in Istanbul, but in my opinion is so famous just because it's placed in a turistic area. I think you should pass trough this square if you want to visit the bazar and other monuments, but just spend the needed time. it's full of people that stop you and offers food, place to sleep, business and so go on..a quick view it's enough

Excellent Square. There's something you need to know where you walk. It was formerly a Roman hippodrome where you walk. The square columns that will remind you. Just think for a minute how everything was beautiful 2000 years ago.

Need a bit of rest on your walking tour of Istanbul?. This wonderful square is located right in the middle of several historic attractions so if you are tired from all the walking up and down those Istanbul hills, enjoy this square with an outside cafe and ice cream, nearby restaurants and places to rest. There is also a tram stop for those using a public transportation. There is Hagia Sophia, The Cistern, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Presidential Palace - it is all there and you can always sit and rest here and watch the beauty.

Very scenic area between two famous mosques.. Just sit back and relax while enjoying the view. Have some Simit and take it all in. That's what I did. I had simit (a Turkish version of a sesame bagel)and just ate it while admiring the view. There are water fountains and flowers surrounding the area as well. You can take great photos of the scenes and take some awesome selfies too while your at it. Family friendly too.

A nice place to rest. This square is situated in the middle of historic places, so if you are a little bit tired from walking or doing sightseen, this place is very conveniente to rest for a while and enjoy from people passing by.
June 2016 Trip. A great place to stroll or just sit and people watch. I was able to enjoy the festivities at sunset during Ramadan which was very special. Highly recommend day or evening.

One of the largest square to visit. Sultan Ahmet and Hagia Sophia museum is in both side of sultan ahmet square. It is large crowded with tourist. Great approtuinty to learn about old Turkey and nice photo. It is in the meddle of old Istanbul and close to several other places you need to see.

Beautiful. I could sit in the square for hours. It's great to see the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, both are just as impressive outside as in. It's especially nice at night when the lights are on. It's a great place to people watch, although it can get warm as there's not too much shade there. It seems a shame that so many people were just passing through. It's also a great place to meet someone to sell you a carpet. So just be aware that friendly locals may invite you to the family shop.

throughfare. It's a public square, so don't expect it to offer anything striking of its own accord. That said, if wanted a place either to... (1) take pictures of nearby sights such as Hagia Sophia ; (2) get a quick cheap snack from street vendors ; (3) do some people-watching as people walk by or sit on park benches -- incl. dog- and cat-watching too ; or (4) get a bearing of where you are without a map or GPS, then this place has the landmarks and space for you to do so. Would not recommend sitting here too long in summer heat. Tram station to other parts of town adjacent.

The Place. If you visit Istanbul, the square should be on the list!Has everything - many of the attractions are just off the square, there are numerous eating places, as well as many little shops and curio places. The transport links from the square also superb. Trams to go towards "town" or towards the "Bosphorus" and the "hop on hop off" buses. There is generally something happening in the square itself, so never a dull moment.
Fantastic place to hang around. Most of the big monuments are located nearby and the place is just stunning. We spent an hour walking around the Sultanahmet Square.

A hub of this wonderful city.. The Blue Mosque is there and the peaceful square is central to all transport links, just two tram stops to the Grand Bazaar in one direction, and two stops in the other to the ferries. Lots of eateries and hotels right there. Very popular with locals and tourists alike. A grand stage was set up to celebrate Ramadan and I’m sure it’s a hub of this wonderful city.

Imagination of Constantinople Hippodrome. Standing in between the obelisk, the wall of obelisk and remaining column, my imagination went to the past when there was a big hippodrome in front of Hagia Sophia. The trace is still there although now it is full of tourists. It's always good to know the history of Constantinople first before visiting the square :-) and I will keep visiting the site because there will be always new history or Archeological knowledge found in this area.
It's beautiful & crowded. It's beautiful area, we can see garden and the beautiful building (Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque) here. There's so many tourist from around the world here.
Oasis in Istanbul. Lovely Square with plenty of shaded areas, Lots of interesting sights to visit around the square & restaurants all around.
Only an access to other sights. Not really interesting or relaxing on its own. Needs more shade and other features. Basically it's sidewalks leading to other worthier places.

Should stiil be on your Bucket List. Even though we were in the airport just one week before the most recent " stupidness " I must still suggest that at some time you see this area and all of its attractions
Beautiful. When you're in Istanbul, you won't miss visiting this place. Around the square, there are other places to visit like the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, The Obelisk and more.

The place to take it all in. . If you're visiting Istanbul you must put time aside to take a seat here and take in all that's on offer. On dusk would be advised, when the sky changes colour, the mosques light up and the fountains come to life.

Beautiful. Beautiful square,very relaxing,a few metres from The Blue Mosque,well presented garden,with little kiosks selling roated corn or roasted chestnuts,a place for a stroll and just to wach time pass by.
BEAUTIFUL Place!. This stunning location is central to so many sights, that cannot be described in photos! It's an easy walk from here, to the spice market, the Grand Bazaar, and several mosques.

Worlds Biggest Mosque (Now 2nd). This place is so huge and the art of constructing this mosque is just amazing and you keep on thinking how they built this huge top of the dome.People gather here for Iftar and there are many local restaurant on the streets but they are not worth it as it is made to steal tourists.you need 3 hours to visit this place and days to explore the beauty of the monument.Must visit place.

An amazing place. My family of six return just a month ago. This is a must go area for anyone visiting Istanbul for the first time. I've been before, and I did notice fewer people this time which is sad. Hopefully, one day I can return!
Center of the universe. Agia Sophia and blue mosqe are intersections to the God. Istanbul is Sultanahmet. Any tourist exists to airport gate wants to go to first place .
Is it a dream ? . Sultanahmet square is amazing - one side is Sultan Ahmet , the second Hagia Sophia , the third Basilica Cistern and the last Topkapi palace. Is it a dream ? No !!!
Love this place for atmosphere. Love this place for it's atmosphere: there are always lots of people, who are very friendly. You can sit on one of the branches and enjoy sunrises.

one of the best place. this is one of the biggest Mosque in Istanbul and really Mosque Sultan Ahmet for me was a discover because i think before that is only like a musium but they pray in a special time as now.
Instructive. on one place two imposant monuments. Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmed Mosque). And on the end obelisk. Beutifull place

Yesterday and today. Sultanahmet Square is a peaceful place (if you ignore the tourist hubbub) between Hagia Sophia and the Sultanahmet ("Blue") Mosque. It's a great place to give an orientation to the Byzantine and Ottoman city, as well as being close to the Hippodrome, the Mosai Museum, Topkapi Palace and Justinian Cistern.

Amazing Atmosphere. The atmosphere is really amazing in Sultanhamet Square, a visit both to Ayia Sofia & Sultanhamet is a must. I find sitting by the fountain in the square very relaxing. I highly recommend visiting the square.

Place to rest or take a tour. Free red umbrella tours starts in front of the fountain in the middle of this squire every day at 10.30. Go ahead and join free discover 2.5 hour discovery of the city. Or just sit down on the bench and enjoy the vibe of the place
Sad to explain!. After terrorist attack, the place is almost empty but still you have to go at least one time in your life period!
Beautiful Place to relax. Beautiful place to visit. There are a lot of small stands where you can eat and relax in the sun or in the shade.

Busy Lively WOW. I visited here a few times and each time I found something new to oggle! Lots of shops, eateries and historic sights.
You will not get bored here!

Green and beautiful. I would say that this is the main square because it connects both mosques, it's very big and it's populated during all year with all kind of people and tourists. In the middle of all that green it's also a fountain. You will find many seats and many cats, as in every park/ square in Istanbul.
Great Views. Go for a walk about, listen to the calls to prayer, take some amazing photos! Mind all the people trying to sell you carpets.

I could sit here all day.. I remember staying here mostly in the morning during my 6-day stay in Istanbul. The place is truly peaceful and relaxing whether early morning or around sunset. The fountain is spectacular, and you see a piece of history in all direction. If you are staying in Istanbul for a period of time, I suggest that you find accommodation within this area so you can enjoy this place.
Oh, the fountains at night!. This place is always pretty, but seeing it at Iftar time with the extra vendors nearby and with all the fountains lit up at night was very special.
Beautiful setting. I find this square simply remarkable When you stand there and look in every direction the amount of history is incredible It is a centrepiece of Istanbul

A Cultural Hub During Ramadan. The square is packed full of people as sunset approaches during Ramadan. Friends and family gather in the square to have a picnic as soon as the sun sets. There was a very beautiful energy and vibe in the square.
Heart of the city. A must visit place in Istanbul. Picturesque square in the historical center - all major historical sites are in the close vicinity.

So much to see and do.. Ok so there are loads of people here and not all of them are what they say they are. There are NO OFFICIAL GUIDES, not even the ones that have a badge saying they are. So don't be fooled into paying for something you don't need. i am sure by reading other reviews you will know what's here already, but just up the road are the underground reservoirs too. They are a peaceful, cool oasis to wander through and now have fish swimming about in their waters. It is not expensive to go in, but the cafe inside is quite pricey so maybe take your own drink/juice. They will not take you more than an hour or so to explore. The queues get long so try and get there first thing or last on your list.

Must visit. There's a lot going on here, from the Blue Mosque to the Hagia Sophia, with plenty of options for food, and huge expanses of grass where you can sit down. There's also a bazaar with a restaurant that has a whirling dervish.
Istanbul in all its glory!. A gorgeous square that one must spend some time on sitting on a bench, sipping pomegranate juice, munching on grilled corncob and people watching!

The heart of Istanbul. It is the main district for tourists who go to Istanbul for its history. The historic area include Sultan Ahmet mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Hypodorme, German fountain and a lots of placed ranked as Must Visit.
Nice area. An interesting are to visit for history aficionados however there is so much beautiful things to see that I recommend to keep this visit at the end of your trip.

Full of life. Its a neat place to walk around and to take pictures. We went there when it was Ramadan so there was every day some sort of events going on in the evening. Its nice to get to experience the square during Ramadan as well and since Turkey is a secular moslem country the restaurants are still open during the day.

Plenty of seating. If you like people watching this is the place to hang out. Beautiful gardens and loads of seating to suit in the sun and shade. The local feral cats and dogs can be a bit unnerving to start with but they are all tagged and vacinnated and are no bother to everyone. The cats are generally friendly but on the whole don't want to be petted and there are often kittens about which are adorable! Right in the centre of the old city this is a good place for meeting or having a break between sightseeing. Lots of restaurants and cafes all around.

Lovely place!. From here you reach all the important "must see's" in Istanbul. Topkapi palace, Sultanahmet mosque, Hagia Sofia. The place itself is beautiful with places to sit and places to eat and drink. We met a lady that fed the cats twice a week. They followed her with great entusiasm when she arrived with her bags with food.

Sultanahmet pleasure.. So picturesque! The fountains were lovely especially in the evening where they are all lit up with colour. Great views of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Such a great atmosphere.

Historical Centre of Istanbul. This is a place where you can just chill all day long and can never get bored of. It is surrounded by magnificent architectural wonders like The Blue Mosque & Aya Sofia and you simply can't stop admiring it's beauty. Other tourists attractions like the German Fountain,Topkapi Palace, Bascilica Cistern and so on also are easily accessible from this place.

Fun to walk around and see the sights. In front of the Blue Mosque and Hagia SophiaVery enjoyable walking experience to see the obelisk and other columnsGood signage and detail on each in English and TurkishFun to sit on benches before you start the dayGo early- 0900

Beautiful view of sultanehmet. great place for picnic for maybe jsut to do nothing. They have benches where you can just sit and enjoy the sun.. Definitely has a great view. Lovely spot to take the pictures. Have mini lunch break after you have finished visiting the square.. It is green and beautiful

The Heart of Istanbul. This place truly is the heart of Istanbul city. From this point, one can easily access the Blue Mosque, Haga Sophia Museum, Topkapi Palace, Gulhane Park, German Fountains, Basilica Cistern, Arasta Bazaar and The Million Stone on foot. All these attractions are just within the radius of 100-150 meters maximum. It is the most happening place of Istanbul where you can see tourists and locals enjoying their time 24/7. Wonderful place with calamity and peace. Your Istanbul trip remains incomplete without this visit.

Great sight, especially magical at night. I definitely recommend a visit during day-time and another at night time, for the fountain gets illuminated at night time and it's sight a pretty sight with the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia in the background.

nice place for visit. first time - dont forget your camera) good place but so crowded
so messy and little dirty everywhere, but nice historical part of city

Touristy Istanbul amenities and food - all in one square. We would pass by the Sultanahmet square while going to the tram station and also when gaining entry to Hagia Sophia. It has small little street shops for coffee and jucies. carts that serve grilled corn, freshly squeezed juices and a lot of police! We enjoyed passing by the square and grabbing a snack as we walked from Tokapi palace to Hagia Sophia.

Sultanhmet Square is one of the most busiest place at Istanbul. Sultanhmet Square is one of the most busiest place at Istanbul, where from we can visit most of the important places and markets of Istanbul

A must!. It feels like the centre of the old city. It is necessary t spend a few moments on a bench and watch the passing parade. At dusk, the lights and fountains are picturesque and it is a must see.

Beautiful Square. In the heart of Sultanahmet, in between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia Ayasofa, a beautiful place to sit down for a bit and perhaps read a book or have a snack next to the fountain!

Beautiful Square. This square is like a park. It links the Hagia Sophia , palace and baths together.. It is beautifully maintained with lovely, wide walks and bright flowers galore. The views of the major attractions allow for great photo shots.

Beautifl location to stroll and sit down, just enjoing street life and ambiens!. Here is the place to go with no guide. Just stroll around, enjoy all the great places. Have a softdrink in the the sun and looking at streetlife, Many of the places in Old Constantionopel / Byzantimum is in walking distance to each other. Great!

Large square right in the heart of old Istanbul. This square is right in the middle of the old Istanbul between mosques. It is full of tourists and food vendors. There's not much shade, so you'll want to just walk through it to your next destination.

Historic Park. With several major mosques within a short walk (including one right on the square), this is a nice center point for meeting, and then walking the area. It is also a nice park in its own right.The only downside is that everyone else is also meeting and relaxing here -- both locals and tourists. It can get pretty crowded at times...

Excellent recreation and walking area. situated between Hagia sofia and sultanahmet mosque is a large squaare where you find lots of food,tourist,and tour buses its almost the midpoint for a walking day trip in istanbul old city.

A Place to Relax. This is a good place to rest after visiting the famous attractions nearby. It's also great for taking photos. We were there in June, and it was not as crowded considering that its surrounding area is packed with tourists.
tourist spot. This square is teeming with tourists any time of the day and even most of the nights. A good place to unwind while visiting the historic sites.

Okay. The square has to be visited to see the mosques. It is pleasant but not a spot to visit per se. My wife and I walked around. Carpet merchants approached us continually, asking if we were lost and offering to help us, and, by the way, would we visit this and that shop.

Evening delight. It's the most incredible feeling to be standing in this square with 2 famous mosques, one front of you, the other behind. In the evenings families are enjoying the cool and quiet, the central fountain is lit up with beautiful colours to compliment the vibe.

Very pretty but too crowded. The architecture and attention to detail is amazing. Unfortunately, the large crowd and queuing into each building was very frustrating.
We just ended up walking the grounds instead. As non Muslims, we were not able to appreciate many of the artifacts on display.
Overall, a beautiful historical site but marred by horrendous queues.
Nice park and eat Kaak. Lovely neighborhood and you can go there at night and day. Don't forget to eat kaak and enjoy the pedestrians.

Serenity & peace in the middle of crowds. In the middle of Blue mosque & Haja Sofia is this square with beautiful plants, flowers, fountains & history of the development of SultanAhmet mosque complex written on the walls. One can spend some time here with a chance to have photographs, rest & enjoy yourself with occasional vendors, who do not bother you unnecessarily. Not to be missed if you have time.

Crammed with delights. Sultanahmet Square can keep you occupied for a full day. In the centre of the square there are various Egyptian artefacts, and around the sides you have Hagia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern and the Blue Mosque. Just a short walk downhill will take you to Tokapi Palace.The square is also the starting point for the Big Bus city tours - a very good way to see what the city has to offer and giving you an idea of the layout of the city.

Simply Magical.. There was just something about this area that made be feel in peace. With the graceful Haga Sophia on one side and the glorious Blue Mosque on the other, simply being here was one of the highlights of my trip - plus with a turkish ice-cream with 3 tops in my hand!

Crowded. I love crowded places but it can also be annoying. I also visited the square at really late at night and once in an early morning and it was amazing to visit because it was EMPTY! (nice picture time)
Beautiful park. We were struck with the cleanliness of the place, the lovely flowers and the grass, and all th families enjoying an outing on a nice weekend.

Super place to feel the heartbeat of the city. This is a super place to walk, or just to sit down ad watch how the daily life goes on. As there is minimal traffic you can let your children run freely.
Great place to sit and relax. Great place to let the beauty of all your surroundings sink in. It is literally in the middle of it all.

Great Escape to the past. Loved to look at the architectures in the area, Mosque on one side, Haqa Sophia on other, the square is a great place to go, a bit crowded though, this is where the hop-on hop-of busses have their station, all tourist busses stop here, so it actually damaging the beauty of this place, people are too loud, so you wont be able to enjoy the ambiance in peace.

Everything in One Place!. All the great sites of Istanbul are right here! What a fantastic place to sit and people watch and take in the extraordinary sites. And what to speak of the yummy snacks! Definitely try the roasted corn and chestnuts!
JUST FULL OF HISTORY. Very beautiful, historic area of Istanbul. Saw Whirling Derwish show in the restaurant we were having dinner

The right place to rest. If you are at the Sultanahmet Square that means that you have visited the Mosque with the same name and you are on your way to Sophia´s place. Or the other way around. Either way, you should sit down, appreciate the ottoman´s architecture and symetry of life. You can get things to eat and drink while you walk from one Mosque to the other.

We love Sultanahmet Square. When you set in the garden of this Square you will see the whole world around you, the whole nations are there, people from all of countries. Very safe, clean and you don't want to leave the place, almost every thing you need is available there. When you look at your back you will see the Blue Mosque and when you look ahead fron of you will see Aya Sophya. It is fantastic place to be, we did enjoy our time all the time over there specially by the fountine of the Square. People visiting this place will have a very memorable memories of Istanbul.

Nice place to chill in the shade. This is a nice place to sit on the grass in the shade and people watch. You have the blue mosque down one end and the Sofia museum down the other. Just as nice at night time when there are no crowds around!
A must see. We were within walking distance from our hotel, plenty to do and see here, and plenty to eat!! Wear comfortable shoes

Best Place in the City. You can simply spend hours in this place without getting bored. The square is sort of a central place in the city having a cluster of important tourist attractions such as Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern etc. besides these, it is always full of life as there are so many tourists here at all times. Many hotels, cafes, restaurants, tourist company offices and currency exchange offices can be found in the vicinity. It can be accessed via the T1 tram.

Historic square. It seems to be the center of the city. The main attractions of Istanbul are all around here like the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque. If you get hungry, there are a lot of restaurants around.

Heart of the city. It is always centre of the city. most important square of the Empire even for todays. There are many places to visit around the square. Topkapı Palace, Sultanahmet Mosque, Haiga Sofia, Basilica and fountains and obelisk and other museums.
Impressive place. You cannot be happy when you are in this square and you have Haia Sofia and the Bule Mosque nearby, topkapi is also close, as well as well known Hamam of Hurem

Happening Place. Most of the famous attractions are on this square. You have lot of restaurants on this place. Also you can get various boat and bus tours from this place. I liked the overall structure , ambience , garden , fountain around this place.
Public space right in the historic centre. The whole area here is like a dream, gorgeous buildings, parks, trees flowers, people relaxing and enjoying themselves.
heaven. it is breath taking. extremely beautiful and green. the best place in a crouded city and yet very peacefull

Amazing views from the front to the back. You have the Hagia Sophia behind you and the incredible Sultan Ahmed Mosque (Blue Mosque) with its incredible spires. many little shops in between and vendors selling their foodstuffs. large open spaces with ATMs and public restrooms. nice place to take a little break.
Sultanahmet Square. We booked a hotel there, food was good, all the historical places wer near by and tram was just 5 min walk away
Buzzing. This is a historic place that is always buzzing. Always a great central meeting place, near pubs, food markets, souvenir shops.

Great place to hang and regroup . This square is so central to the most important sites that it is a pleasure to relax near the fountain, see the flower gardens and people watch. The mosques are readily visible and there are great restaurants nearby.

Central point to most historical places as well as the tram. Beautiful square where the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia are located. The fountains at the square lits up in different colours at night. Spectacular.

Stunning tulip gardens. A pleasant square where the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia face one another. at night coloured lights in the fountains make for lively scenery complementing the daytime colours of the Tulip gardens.
1-30 April. A place where you feel the history. Especially you need to see tulip festival in April, it gives visual pleasure. Even just a great pleasure to see the Hagia Sophia

well maintained. this area is very well maintained, theres lots of seating areas as well as beautiful water features and trees, the food carts are not over priced as you would expect from tourist areas. theres a lovely atmosphere.

A must. Probably the main spot in Istanbul. To be honest very difficult to explore the area in peace as this is also the hangout for most people looking to rip of tourists. But all in all a must visit in Turkey.
LOVELY!. Lovely to walk around in a completely relaxed and safe setting. Enjoyable in the day time as well as at night -- each a very different experience.

The spot.. This is the spot where most tourist will end up. It contains 4 of the most seen attractions. Wont get into describing the area since it has been reviewed plenty. My only caution is to be care of all the men walking up to you trying to be friendly. They are all trying to sell you rugs or to go to their shops. They are relentless. Being nice is not enough. Recommend not mentioning your from the US or any place that speaks English.

Beautiful fountain at night . The square is between Hagia Sophia and Sultanahmed Mosque. A few hawkers around selling roast nuts and both grilled and boilled corn.There is also a tram stop which takes you to the Bazzar and the other way goes to the Bosporus/ Galata Bridge

Heart of the Historic Pennisula. The Square is turly the heart of the tourist district - the "Historic Pennisula". It is immediately adjacent to the Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern and the Hippodrome. There is a handy light rail (trolley) that runs around the Pennisula with a station next to the Square. Within a few blocks are the Topkapi Museum (among others), innumerable boutique hotels and restaurants, and within walking distance are the Grand Bazaar (though the trolley also goes there), and a moderate distance walk down the hill the Suleymaniye Mosque, the Spice Markets, the Galata Bridge , the Golden Horn waterway and more shops and markets and mosques beyond counting. Arranging to stay at one of the boutique hotels within a few blocks of the Square leaves you ideally placed for touring the historic sections of Istanbul. The hotels do vary considerably so don't trust to blind luck- look up reviews before you pick one.
Nice area. Green Area close to Sultan Ahmed Mosque. Many resturant. Close to Metro and Bazar. Also in this area many Hotels. This area is international area.

Fun Place to Stroll. Always active with people and vendors, this square is fun to visit day or night. There are tourists from all over the world, as well as locals. Beware of the most adorable stray cats, that are very friendly and lonely. I love the views of Haiga Sofia as well as the Blue Mosque. There is so much stimulus here you can easily spend a few hours of entertainment.

amizaing. The Sultan ahmed district is the heart of historic Old Istanbul, what 19th-century travelers used to call Stamboul,This is where you'll find Topkapı Palace, Ayasofya (Hagia Sophia), the Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmet Camii), the Byzantine Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern (Yerebatan Saray), Binbirdirek Cistern, the Istanbul Archeological Museums, Great Palace Mosaic Museum, and several lesser sights (see map below).It's your best base for sightseeing in Istanbul. For a rundown on things to see, go to Istanbul Sights. (Here's a good, inexpensive guided walking tour.)
Beautiful place!. The beautiful place which shows the atmosphere of Istanbul. Must seen on your list! :D On the square you can see two beautiful mosque which look mervelous!

A Square that keeps you Going in Circles. Every time I have visited this Square, I have always felt at home. My thoughts encircle me and I feel like in another World. The Aya Sofiya at one end and the Blue mosque at the Other. Truly Lovely. Visit and Spend time at this Square,to be encircled with Magic Vibes :)

The lobby of Istanbul. From this place you can see the Haja Sofia Church and the Blue Mosque simultaneously. The sea is also near by. During a certain period of the year on this place there is also and a celebration with flowers which also is worth seeing.

5th grade history class comes to life!. There I was, walking through the square, surrounded by obelisks, columns and other monuments from the time of Constantine. I had been fascinated with this city since learning about it in 5th grade...Constantinople, now Istanbul. Amazing to see the history in this area.

A great place for a break. Sit down and enjoy an ice cream or a snack in this nice square while watching the world go by. It is right in the middle of the most interesting area for tourists on sight seeing tour in Istanbul.

Good For Picture taking. Most of the mosques in Turkey are the same,just different sizes,it's all about vendors trying to sell you something,restaurants and turkish delight,dentists must make lots of money in Turkey.

Tranquility. This is a perfect place if you want to have a little break from it all and just take in thr scenery. Istanbul at its best. Theres cafes all around the area as well as vendors selling sweetcorn and chesnuts. Its nice to just sit down here with an ice cream and cold drink and just relax.
THE place to take pictures. all I wanna say is DO NOT forget your camera and look your best, cause this is THE spot to take pictures in Istanbul
Impressive. When you come here you get the feeling that time takes you back hundreds of years. Make sure you read the history of this in order to get a better idea of what is going on.

Beautiful area ...even at night. It was sad to know that this area was attacked by terrorists recently. It was the safest place to be. Most beautiful area where Ahmed meets Sophia . Incidentally , both are my my parents names!
great stroll. great place for a stroll in between visits to hagia sophia and the blue mosque, you will find food stalls around that will keep you entertained
People Watching. This is a great place to relax and take in the amazing history that is all around you. Take a few minutes to sit down and just watch the people around you.
Superb Natural Beauty & Matchless Architecture. A perfect place.Sit there & you'll find Blue mosque at one side & Haga sofia at the other. Nice background for pictures.
The Blue Mosque and surrounding area. This square and the Blue Mosque are very beautiful. We were here just a week ago. Nearby are many good eating places serving Turkish food.

Busy centrepiece between the Blue Mosque and the Haiga Sofia. Great area to sit and people watch whether during the day or late into the evening. Took some great photos of the spectacular buildings either side of the square.
holiday. This is a lovely place to sit between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Lots of benches to rest and plenty of places to buy drinks and food.

Flowers, great views. It's in the middle of Serkeci, on the left is the Blue musk and on the right Ag.Sophia, all historical, colorful and little crowded as everybody comes here while visiting Istanbul.

At the heart of history. Many historic places where located in that square such as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Obeliks etc. You might spend all day to visit around. You can catch some good view for photo. When you feel hungry you can taste any local food, gözleme, köfte, şerbet, macun şeker etc. To reach there you may use tramvay, cheap way..

Clean and in good order.. Nice place to relax, sips sweet tea and enjoy the world goes by, if the weather is kind.
The area is free from touts, clean, well kept and in order.
Three great reasons to visit. The square itself is beautiful with a lovely fountain. Even better are the views of the Museum one end and then turn around for fantastic views of the Blue Mosque

Relaxing!. Great views all around. Just get a snack, sit on a bench, and people watch! Can't go wrong with visit the square. A nice market area down the steps.. can't remember the name but great Hukka places there.

a beautiful square in the heart of istanbul. A great place to walk and experience the beauty of old town istanbul. on a hot summer's day this pleasant square really made the trip a fun one. highly recommend

A joyful stroll.... It wasn't as crowded as before. Perhaps it is not a school break season or maybe the bombings scared the tourists away but I am not complaining. Many photo opportunities without people straying into my camera shots unlike my visit about a year ago.
Since it is spring now, the area in front of Hagia Sophia has a tulip carpet.

Great Social point. Loved it here with the kids, between the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi. Lovely tulips for the April Tulip festival and they always have something going on.
Children loved to watch the fountains or run about. It's a great place to take photos from all angles.
Some great little food outlets, chestnut stalls and corn on the cob.
peaciful. You would feel the centuries stamped on this city while you're around Sultanahmet Square. The time that Christianity and Muslim world first meet in a civilized way.

beautiful place. between sultanahmet and hagia sophia you will stand on the very beautiful landmark to take a photo because you will collect two of them and also around this square it's many cafe and food there but be careful of your stuff like bag wallet phone...

Beautiful Time of year. In April is the annual Tulip Festival in the Square. The Square sits between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. There is a most beautiful fountain that changes colors at night. In the park are flowers, people to see, vendors with Limits, Boiled corn, and roasted chestnuts. It is just a beautiful location.In april, the block off a football field size area and make a carpet of tulips (560,000 tulips) and it is just magnificent.

Lovely square!. Come in the evening as it's lively and friendly (and very safe due to discreet but plentiful police presence). Have an ice cream and sit on one of the many benches. Local dogs also share this square. They have been tagged & are well-looked after.

Special Gardens. A great clean area to sit in the shade of the trees, near the fountain or among the beautiful garden beds and blossom trees. Plenty of photo opportunities and food outlets in the area with friendly locals to talk to.

Surprising Excellent Piece of Greenry in a Busy City. The city did a magnificent job in building and maintain this park well situated among some of the greatest sights in Istanbul. There were local families, tourists picnicking, playing in the on the grass, enjoying the fountain. Numerous benches were one could buy a snack or treat from nearby vendors and sit and marvel at all the history in the surrounding area.Very relaxing area for such a busy city and a resting place for weary touirists.

inevitable. even if you dont want to visit, you have to go. It is a trademark of the city and you need to have some photos there . Just live the athmosphere and enter the mosque,palace and museum around.

A Bustling, Beautiful Square. The Square is so pretty, and so central to so many attractions in Istanbul. Always busy, you can easily find a vendor selling pretzels, bagels or roasted chestnuts. Originally the old Hippodrome, the square still has some original monuments standing. Just below the Hotel Alzer is an amazing little coffee shop that serves the best Turkish coffee I tasted on our entire trip.
Great Ara to hang out and feel the history. Very old and historical significant area. All historical landmarks in walking distance from it. Also it is full of cafes and shopping.

Main sites are all here. Walking this square is interesting, historic and I suppose the enjoyment depends upon the numbers walking, too. If crowded, it can't be as pleasant as when we were there, early April, before full tourist season is full-on.
Great square. Typical European Square with great views of the mosques and the neighborhood. Great spot to sit and grab and snack ...

Lovely. This square is very special. Very accessible to get there and very spacious. There concentrates the main mosquitas the city and there benches to sit and enjoy being able to eat some Turkish snack: D
Sultan ahmet SQ. Heart of Old Istanbul. All hotels, shops, resturants are here including the anicient Historical Buildings like Blue Mosque.
Beautiful place. Beautiful place in a sunny day, and also night time with the fountain colors. we took nice pictures, had ice cream with funny tricks and corn on cobs. kids loved it!

Enjoy the place. This was my second time of visit.
An old place but you never get bored, i love the whole place , park , nature, history ,..

Great Outdoor Area. A very nice outdoor area with great outside views of mosque and the palace. Food vendors, fountains, benches, flowers, and places to eat nearby. Even a big WC area. You really can't avoid this area and see the attractions, but if it's nice out enjoy the stroll around. And never talk to a local. They just want to sell you carpet.

An historic marvel. This square is a a vibrant area containing some of the most sought after historic sights in Istanbul. The square is beautifully maintained and provides ample room for wandering about gazing at the amazing buildings and park setting. Many great restaurants and other tourist facilities are adjacent to the square and transportation to other areas of Istanbul are right on site. A truly world class district.
Great square. You can see the square is located between the Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Beware the hustlers who will want to be your tour guide. LOL>
Amazing. Wonderful architecture and beautiful landscaping make for a very pleasant experience in the Square. Also, available cafes make for convenient refreshment opportunities.
historical place. it was a nice historic place that i would suggest you to visit it at least one time. that would be a great experience.

Lovely Part of Istanbul But Can Be Busy. This is the area tourists gravitate towards, which can be off-putting. Personally I detest being near big groups of tourists but in this area it is worth it. There are some great places just off the square so it is well worth locating yourself around here.
Highlight of Istanbul. This area of Istanbul is beautiful, bustling, historic and lots to see, do and learn. I've visited Istanbul several times and always enjoy when I get over to Sultanahmet area.

Bustling, lively and rich history!. This is the perfect tourist spot! Flanked by hagia sofya and sultanahmet mosque, the square as the hippodrome, obelisks and obelisk wall along with the snake column. The small benches in the area make for great photography spots. The square is also frequented by a lot of locals so you also get a good cultural feel of Istanbul here. A must see!
i love this place,so beautiful and feeling happy when i going to it. I told everyone go to Istanbul to visiting sultanahmed and walk near of this area and shopping from Egyption bazar

Spend the day taking in Istanbul's beautiful sites!. The Square is home to most of Istanbul's famous attractions which include the Blue Mosque (free); Hagia Sophia (TL 30); Topkapi Palace (TL 30 to TL65) ; The Serpents column (free), The walled obelisk (free); The obelisk of Thutmose III (free) and the German Fountain (free). The Basilica Cistern (TL 15) is a mere 40m walk from the square and the Grand Bazaar is within walking distance too.It is very large and has numerous benches scattered around which are convenient for taking a break from seeing the sites or for grabbing a quick bite from one of the food carts to be found on the square. We travelled in winter and various breads; corn and roasted chestnuts were on offer.As the square is open to the elements and provides very little cover, i would recommend carrying an umbrella or raincoat if rain is predicted.Apart from the attractions mentioned, there are ATM's; an outdoor cafe; a permanent kiosk offering various snacks, drinks and reading material; a large fountain; bicycle parking areas and many curio stores selling various wares. Lots of trendy cafe's and restaurants may be found in the immediate surrounds too.The square is also home to a large number of street cats and dogs who were friendly and kept to themselves.Public transport to Sultanhamet is via the metro tram (dark blue line) or the hop-on hop-off bus.

Nice place to walk aroung in sunny day.. Interesting place to walk around in a sunny day.Some of the nicest mosques around and other cultural and historical places to visit. Fits all ages and tastes in terms of history.It's a "must go" place.

History of this square is excellent.. Went here on Tuesday the 12 of January, the day of the bombing. We arrived at the square when a loud bang was heard. Within minutes hundreds of Police vehicles and ambulances arrived, forcing us of the square, away from Sultanahmed towards Topkapi and Gülhane. We found out later, that a bomb killed 10 Tourists only 100 yards away. We could not visit the square and the Blue Mosque till Thursday, when everything got re-opened. The square is a beautiful area to relax with 1000 of years of history. On one end of the square is the Blue Mosque and on the other side the Hagia Sophia. In between is an assortments of green areas, fountains and benches to relax. The picture is finished of with traders selling ice cream, milk with honey and nuts. Very relaxing place. A place where you inter the ancient history. “Sultanahmet Square” a new modern black stone Square came from history, the place was the center of ancient Roman city, the center of Othman capital, all history surround this space of bountiful area, with Istanbul “Tramway” crossing all the way, stopping at Sultanahmet’s tram stop then go behind to its next stop at ‘Gülhane”, it present you the future with the smell of history.Around you can go to “Sultanahmet Camii/ Sultanahmet Mosque” or as people Know it as the “blue mosque” – visiting “Ayasofya”, discovering the Roman underground water tank “Basilica Cistern”, or simply going up to the gate of “Topkapı Palace” where Othman “Sultans” govern the impair.The first place we have visit in Istanbul, we used meat our friend there or Just sit in the middle of tis garden watching people, feeding birds, eating corns and snacks, or simply resting around fountains after a busy day.If you visit Istanbul without stopping at Sultanahmet Square, you miss the beautiful of the old city

Formerly the Hippodrome. This large square is off Sultanahmet Park, which sprawls between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The square marks the place where part of the Hippodrome, known as the horse arena in the Ottoman era, formerly stood. It holds four monuments -- Serpent Column, Theodosius Obelisk, Masonry Obelisk and the German Fountain. As a history buff, I enjoyed walking along the paved square and reading the information sign by each monument, Details appear in three languages, including English. Two sides of the square hold a few grassy areas, each enclosed by low, white metal fences. Lamp posts and benches stand nearby. I sat for a while and watched the few people, who were visiting the square on a weekday morning, stroll by. It was quite pleasant to rest here, away from the crowds at Sultanahmet Park.

In the heart of everything. The square is right in the middle of all the places that are must sees. The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia sit opposite each other and there is a fountain in the middle where you can relax and take in there beauty. There are also Roman and Egyptian historical sites as well as a water fountain donated by the Germans. A great place to start your adventure!
Wonderful Mosque. Its huge structure ,Looks wonderful well maintained,Surrounding area is very nice.Must visit place for tourist

turn left or right and you have a great sight. the square is a gathering place of locals and tourists alike. flanked by the Blue Mosque and the Saint Sophia Church/Mosque marvel, with its light up fountain at night, this place is a must. Great Area to Explore. A visit to Istanbul without seeing spending time in in Sultanahmet district which is the heart of historic old Istanbul would be a sad occurrence as there is so much to see from there. From the Topkapı Palace to the Ayasofya (Hagia Sophia) to the famous Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmet Camii) and others such as the Byzantine Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern (Yerebatan Saray), Binbirdirek Cistern, the Istanbul Archeological Museums, Great Palace Mosaic Museum and several lesser sights one will not be disappointed. It is probably easier to make this district your base for sight-seeing as there are so much to see. The district of Sultanahmet (sool-tahn-ah-MEHT, named for Sultan Ahmet I, builder of the Blue Mosque) has many restaurants as well as hotels with excellent prices. Two obelisks facing one another are still to be seen in Sultanahmet square. One of these, is the Walled Obelisk at the rear part of Sultanahmet Square which was set up by Constantine VII. and the other the Obelisk of Thutmose III.
BEAUTIFUL SQUARE. A beautiful and wonderful scenery. A nice place just to sit down and enjoy and to watch people passing by.

Treasure from Roman, Byzantine and Ottoman era. The huge Sultan Ahmet Square provides you enjoyment of discovery historical and cultural treasure from Roman, Byzantine and Ottoman era. If you have limited time, make your sightseeing priorities and make every minute worthy of your visit.HOW TO GET TO THIS SQUAREIt is easy accessible by tram line T1 or metro line Zeytinburn-Kabataš /get off at Sultan Ahmet sq. stop/. A more beautiful option is drive by tourist buses get on&get off. They have stop in front of Blue mosque.WHAT TO SEE- The major attractions represent: Blue mosque or Sultan Ahmet mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi palace and Basilica Cistern. These sights are located within walking distance. Only problem could be lines in front of these sights. Let say, only visit to Topkapi palace involves four hours at least. Also, lines plus visit to each of mentioned attractions involve half day. - Two beautifully decorated fountains are worthy of your admiration. The first one is the Fountain of Ahmet III in rococo style with adorable tiles and valuable inscription in front of the Topkapi palace. The second one is the Fountain of Emperor Wilhelm II with polished granite columns and golden mosaic dome in front of Blue mosque.- Take a walk along the narrow and windy streets of this area. It is really a beautiful experience. I came across the charming traditional Turkish houses beautifully painted in blue, green, red color. Don't miss Sogukcesme street, that runs parallel to the the walls of Topkapi palace and you will find the wooden houses, typical examples of Ottoman architecture. HAVE A BREAKThere ate street's stands offering freshly made natural juices. If you prefer to have a break at table, don't miss the rooftop cafes and restaurants. You will be rewarded with an amazing view.PAY ATTENTION TO:Be patient in case of long lines in front of attractions. Bring with yourself the city map in any case.Although, Istanbul is a Mediterranean city, it could be cold, rainy and even snowy weather during winter, so put on yourself the warm clothes / don't forget umbrella, cap, scarf and gloves/.And enjoy this meeting point of Roman, Byzantine and Ottoman era.

A circus no more for sporting. This place cannot deny that it once was the Hippodrome of Constantinople. Next to it was the palace of the Byzantine Emperor and the Hagia Sophia. The first Hippodrome was built in 203 AD, but Constantine the Great decided to rebuilt it after selecting the city as "New Rome", his new capital. If you need a place for social gathering with the longest history, this is the most likely candidate. For about 20 centuries, the social life of Bysantium., later Constantinople, and now Istanbul focused here. During the Byzantine period, Political discussions were often made at the Hippodrome, which could be directly accessed by the Emperor through a passage that connected the Kathisma (Emperor's Loge at the eastern tribune) with the Great Palace of Constantinople. During the Fourth Crusade in 1204, Hippodrome was ruined like most other remarkable places, and the four horses (Quadriga) that stood here were looted and brought to Venice to be installed on the façade of St Mark's Basilica in Venice.This place witnessed not only the Nika Riots in AD 532, but also the killing of some Byzantine Emperors, Ottoman Sultans, and also the end of one of the most famous armies (The Janissaries). They rioted multiple times on this square, killed at least in sultan, and finally killed in 1826 after a riot. The first palace of the sultans in Istanbul (Topkapı) is near the place, same is true for the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet) which gives the square the current name.To my youth, this place was the favourite location for public hangings. Next to it was the jail for the convicts (now a luxury hotel). Later, the hippies took over, and the "Pudding Shop" was populated by beatniks and, later on, hippies and other travelers on overland route between Europe and India, Nepal, and elsewhere in Asia - the "hippie trail" to Afghanistan and Goa. Even President Clinton ate here.Some of the hippies still populate the area, but it is not easy to detect them because the population density of the square is that high that at times it is not easy to walk. Never take a taxi to here, only the tram.
