Beautiful Istanbul. We went on a short visit to Istanbul this summer. A large part of the population was strictly observing the holy month of Ramadan but as tourists we did not feel at all restricted or inconvenienced. We were charmed to experience the spirit of solidarity & community displayed during fast-breaking at Sultanahmet Square where the whole city seemed to have congregated in a general air of festivity. Istanbul is a beautiful & well organised city. The mix of Asian & European cultures is seamless & evident in the landscape as well as the people. We stayed at a local hotel close to the Sultanahmet Square, which though was a more 'budget' experience than we had bargained for, turned out to be a great decision due to being within walking proximity to so many of the city's best attractions around the Square. We were thus able to allocate the organised tours to the far-off sites such as the palaces & Bosphorous while we made full use of walking & the tram system to explore the old city on our own. We found the tram-metro link to be very economical & tourist friendly. It is handy to know the timings of the various attractions in advance as not all sites are open on all days. The locals were truly hospitable & very cosmopolitan in their approach. Vendors at the Grand Bazaar can be very aggressive though so if not wanting to buy anything this place could be avoided. Everyone suggests trying the seafood restaurants either in the old city or under the Bosphorous bridge, but both were big disappointments for us. The food consisted mainly of cold salads & boiled/steamed fish which were priced too high. The restaurant staff are extremely aggressive to the point of downright rudeness in trying to attract customers into their joint, but most serve exactly the same menu items. They often also promise discounts or freebies to lure one in but by the time the meal is completed the promises are mostly forgotten. This was the biggest turn-off in our entire trip, and honestly the best meal we had was at a very modest eatery patronized only by locals hidden in a back-street, of various meats being grilled on a large open fire. This is a city we could easily return to any day for a second visit.

SultanAhmet Mosque. It is one of the most incredible mosques and squares in Istanbul, you will view amazing nature with inspiration with sprites.
I recommend to visit.

Lovely Location. Lovely location between the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Topkapi Palace is just a short walk behind Hagia Sofia. Just watch out for all the "friendly" people. They are trying to lure in to rug shops. This is all over, everywhere you walk.

Picturesque beyond belief. I returned to the square again and again, because it was simply so stunning. It was central to the area I was staying, which made it an ideal place to start and end each day. I was thrilled with the fountain (we don't seem to be able to have anything like this in England without someone damaging it). It is covered around its sides with mosaic pictures, which add to it's beauty.I was so pleased I got back there in the evening, as the fountain lights up and changes colour too, which is lovely to watch.Despite it being very central to a number of attractions, and having a fair amount of people, it never felt crowded, and you could feel really peaceful here.I liked the stray dogs wandering around, although it may not be to everyone's taste - there are only a few regulars, and you can see that they are tagged - the authorities catch them, vaccinate and neuter them, put a tag for tracking into their ear, then release them at the same spot. Volunteers feed the city's animals on certain corners so they don't go hungry and restaurants often feed their leftovers to the animals, but there is no mess.The square is very clean and tidy, and the gardens well kept.

I recommend going there and then move outward to the many lovely streets returning to enjoy the people having coffee, watch the people strolling with children and families, listening and experience the beauty of Istanbual. A People of Peace.
Wow. Fantastic views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia you get a real feel of the history of the place nice to walk or sit and soak up the atmosphere of the place
A large and beautiful square. Very impressive square, surrounded by a lot of large and impressive mosques. i think this is a place you must visit when you are in Istanbul.
Perfect especially at 8 PM. Just perfect place to have some rest, drink turkish coffee or tea, especially it is magical at around 8 PM when muezzin is calling to prayer from the top of minaret.

Truly beautiful. Many people with different cultures. A Church which is also a Mosque and a very big normal Mosque. When the prayer call starts, then it's peacefull. Christians and muslims, just like very good FRIENDS. Truly amazing place.

The PLACE to be!. While in Istanbul, one cannot miss spending some time in the Sultanahmet Square. The street vendors, the tourists, the locals - all converge together in a big happy pot. Mention - cannot miss the prayer time - morning and evening especially, when three imams in the three Mosques around the Square follow each other in sequence during prayer - it is uplifting no matter what religion one belongs to.
Great Tourist area. Great Area to see alot of the main touristic sights of Istanbul. Easy to get to and many restaurants around.
Amazing Square!!!!. All the famous monuments are near to the suare like Aya Sofia,Basillica Cistern,Blue Mosque, Indian Restaurant etc.

Sit and watch and listen. This is a wonderful place to sit and watch and feel Istanbul. I really enjoyed the evening call to prayer with the musical chanting coming from all of the surrounding mosques. It was out of this world to watch the people wandering by and being surrounded by the old mosques and the beautiful fountains. There were also lots of cats wandering around. We went here every afternoon to sit, watch and listen to the wonderful city of Istanbul

Wonderful day and night. With so much to see in and around the square, this place is definitely the most frequented place by most tourists. The atmosphere is wonderful and there are several places to eat around the square. The parks and the fountain next to the square are lovely in the evening for sitting and relaxing.

A restful oasis. It is a really busy square as it is full of tourists, buses, business seekers and stray dogs, but it is surprisingly restful too. Lots of benches to sit, fountains and places to buy snacks. Good to sit and people watch, pet the dogs and cats and in the evening watch the light display around the flower beds.

different opinion. We actually spent the least amount of time in the square. The obelisks are cool, but we have seen the original sized ones in Egypt, which are simply enormous. The plaza itself is very clean, but what´s annoying are the number of `police`vehicles taking up space.

Top people watching spot. When visiting Sultanahmet, you can't avoid the square as it is in the heart of all the main sights. It is a great place to sit and rest weary feet and watch all the people around you! There are many benches here which are perfect for this purpose.

Beautiful park between Hagia Sofia and Blue mosque. Nicely landscaped, lots of benches to sit and enjoy the sites and sounds of Istanbul. Street vendors selling corn on the cob, calls to prayer from the mosques several times a day can be heard. great view of the blue mosque at one end and the hagia sofia at the other.

Crowdy & Nice Place. The place is always full of people here to see the famous blue mosque and other attractions nearby.There are lots of option of food nearby which serves great doner kebab and other turkish cuisines.Must visit place in Istanbul.Loved this place.
The depths of history. Sultanahmet Square is second well known square in Istanbul. (1st one is Taksim Square) You can feel the history and the power of Ottoman clearly by surrounding of this square.
Unforgettable!. A must to visit! Stroll the beautiful gardens with the Blue Mosque on one side and the magnificent Hagia Sophia on the other! An experience to remember forever.
Must visit when in istanbul. The history surrounding the square is awe inspiring. You can spend several days visiting the museums, mosques and bazaars within walking distance

This Square is a must see. If you go to Istanbul and don't spend several hours (at least) in this place, you are making a big mistake. The Blue Mosque is on one end (a must see) and the Haghia Sophia and Topkapi Palace (also both must see) are on the other. The Square in between is loaded with also must see attractions ... from ancient items, a few cool shops and several places to just sit and take it all in.

The thing to see on this square are the buildings that surround it.. I liked coming back after forty years, but the atmosphere is different now than then. More hostile. The square is really nothing but a square with a few kiosks selling food.

Must photo-op!. This square is the quite busy during the day with locals and tourists alike. But is just an attractive area to just walk around because you have 2 fantastic photo opportunities with the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofya right there. There is plenty of space to roam and park benches to just rest and soak it all in. Enjoy some of the street food while you area at it- fresh cooked sweet donuts, grilled corn and nuts, si it, etc... There are also cafes you can have a sit down for a good meal and refreshments.
Brilliant square. Definitely wait for a bench to free up, get some ice cream and soak up one of the most amazing views in the world. Because the outside is better then the inside.

A slightly more sober and touristy version of Taksim. The main street leading up to Sofia and Sultanahmet is filled with touristy bars and restaurants. The place is less lively compared to Taksim and more expensive. If you go in the lanes and slightly off the main road, you would find bars that are far cheaper and everyone negotiates for a good deal. The place is usually filled with older people who want to enjoy the touristic part of Istanbul
Nice to stroll around. As I say in the title it's a nice place to stroll around take in the sights, people and odors. It is really crowded because to really big sightseeing spots are really close.
Great experience. Most of the great tourist places are at walking distance. Can be reached by Tram. Great place for photo opportunities and chill.
All in one place. One of the areas we simply loved. Topakapi Palace, Hagia Sophia Mosque and Blue Mosque. All the placed together. Beautiful open restaurants around. Good food to eat.
Busy and dirty. A nice square very busy surprised by how many cigarette butts everywhere nota particularly clean area shame as it has such historic importance and lovely buildins

I will definitely be back (i Hope). We were in a small 'boutique' hotel close by, and we used to walk through it on most of our daily excursions into Old istanbul, & trudge back weary & contented at nightfall. it is an entirely enjoyable place for the family, for children playing, and for lovers walking around. At night with the illumination of the mosque serving as a background, with the seagulls flying around into & out of the lights it takes on an entirely different look.
Great central sightseeing location. All the major sights are accessible from here (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sohia, Topkapi Palace) and its on the tram line also...

Vibrant Centre square for tourists and locals. Beautiful large public square in between Hagia Sophia Church and the Blue Mosque. From here you may take the Hop-on hop-off bus, the tram to various places, walk to Topkapi Palace, the Spice bazaar, train station, Bosphorus river boats and Grand Bazaar. The locals sitting around are friendly and helpful and guides will approach you without harassing you. There are many restaurants in the vicinity.

Must visit. This square is a must if you are visiting Istanbul. The ambiance is very impressive. A lot of tourists around. Great views of Blue mosque. It is also nice at night with the blue mosque iluminated

Surrounded by History... Very refreshing place to sit and drink Turkish tea or coffee and sooth your eyes with beautiful views of Blue Mosque especially when the lights are on. Great place for photography of mosque.
It's just a park. It is quite pretty but it's just a park. A good place to have lunch or hang outside, but nothing too exciting. There are street vendors around it for food and souvenirs.
Central Location for LOTS to See. Many, many of the important historical sites are all right here within walking distance. A MUST for Istanbul.

An Amazing Place to Relax, Photograph, and take in the View.. A wonderful square to gaze at the Hagia Sophia Church and walk on down to the Ippodromos. A place to see tourists from all over the world and chat with them. The best place to take photos at!
Istanbul's heart. You will pass through the square countless times during your visit - stop and linger, imagine the history and be sure to visit at sunset and after dark as well. Pure magic.
Beautiful. I love the square surrounded by a a few mosques and beautifly kept gardens. It can be crowded and full of beggars but overall a must see in Istanbul
Everything in Walking Distance. The square is a very crowded area, but you get easily walk to many key tourist sites such as Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc.
beautiful so much history. fantastic vies of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia , cistern all right there. and a short walk to the grand bazzar

History happens here. I felt priviledged to be able to view this important square from my hotel room. Then I actually was able to walk through it myself. It is always full of people. During the day, they walk through on the way to somewhere; at night it becomes a gathering place.

It's like the whole world is there!. We loved sitting in Sultanahment Square watching all the people. It seemed like every walk of life was there from Americans to Europeans to Africans to Asians to Middle Easterners. And we were all friendly and got along! Amazing. (Now if only the heads of state could do that.) It's a beautiful spot filled with happy tourists. Enjoy a simit or corn on the cob from one of the vendors. Toward the Hagia Sophia there is an ice cream vendor and a restaurant. Be wary of guys selling boat tours and tickets to events. Some are counterfeit.
Three historic sites in one Square. The Blue Mosque, Hagia shopia and the palace are all located in this square. There are many more museums and small historic buildings in this place.
All tourist life is there!. Great for watching the (tourist) world go by, taking photos, seeing the exteriors of the main sights, especially Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque

Crowded but interesting. A bit of green belt right by the historical sites. Good for people watching and most attractions are very close. Public washrooms available. Cost 1 Lira to use, but they are clean. Easy to walk and the Arasta Bazaar is very close.

Everything happens here. This is the heart of the old city, the tour buses all stop here and everyone is busy going from one palace or mosque to another. many of the people are Turkish from other places, seeing their city to absorb its history and culture. Take time to sit and watch.
Simply Okay. Great little square. Not much to see except the Mosque and Sophia. If it's warm enough, maybe a picnic could be in order.

Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque) Square. This is a square where horse rices were used to be held. You should definitely go and see this square. Topkapı Palace, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern is pretty close to here. Just like 2-3 minutes walk!
Great park to relax in. In the centre of the area - so many attractions within a short walking distance. Public transport to and from here.

Love the vibe of this place. Oh this place is just awesome! With the Blue Mosque on one side and the Hagia Sophia on the other and the beautiful fountains and gardens in between. Relax on one of the benches with a corn on the cob or a simit from one of the push carts and watch the world go by. The feeling is amazing!

Must see in Istanbul, City of two Continents. This would be choice one if you have only one day in Istanbul. The "Square", or rather, the pedestrian "Mall" is between the 2 most significant Historical Architecture or Land-Marks of this great historical city (the only one partly in Asia and partly in Europe). The "Hagia Sophia" (historical church, mosque and now a museum) is at the North-East end of the "square" while the "Blue Mosque" is on the South-West end. The square is in many ways the Center of the City and within walking distance to many of the significant sights of the city.

Come at sunset. This is a beautiful square to lounge in as the evening begins. When the sun sets low and then the golden hour when the light on buildings is just perfect -- that's when to take some photos and experience the exotic flavor of this very international city. Listen to the prayer calls from the different mosques and just let it all swirl around you as it has for the past thousands of years. Then it's an easy walk to great restaurants. Istanbul is the epicenter of great food.
Ground Zero for Istanbul. The Sultanahmet Square is the place to access all the must see sights in Istanbul...The tram takes you to its door step and from here minutes ti the major sites.

An integral part of your Istanbul visit. A a tourist to Istanbul you'll most likely see a lot of Sultanahmet Square. There are several important and interesting buildings around the square and it's right in the heart of the old city of Istanbul so it's a good place to know your way around. It's very busy during the day and less frantic at night, but there's always something to see. The nighttime lighting is beautiful, especially the fountain. And the foods around the square suit every taste. (An ice cream at midnight was our favourite.) The place felt very safe and it's well-policed 24/7.
Chilling with a tea!. Great place to sit and relax and have a glass of tea and sth to eat with a stunning view on both sights :)

In the middle of Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque, perfect views on both sides.. The square provides the perfect location to admire the beauty of both the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque. There are plenty of benches to be able to sit down and enjoy their beauty.

Most of Istanbul historical attractions. Here you can spend a day, two or even three days based on your level of interest, wondering through the historically rich district, architecturally astonishing buildings, mosques, bridges and towers.
Always great to be there!. Its such a fascinating area! So much to see, so much to visit, so much to taste!I am always excited when walking that area!
great choose for plan. nice environment and great history in this area for learning what happen before in this part of world.
Great area and one of the best tiurist centers in the world. The region is the heart of old Istanbul for mosques, the Hagi Sopiha, hotels, food places, shopping, bazaars. Its alive and entrancing

Pleasant breathing space between the sights. four stars because of its location at the heart of the two great icons of the city: Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It symbolises the pull of east vs west that grips Turkey even today, and is a fine place to think about that issue. Even better to see the tourists and locals relaxing and enjoying the views, and in summer, lounging in the grassy areas. Plenty of traders selling nuts, simit breads and grilled sweet corn and chestnuts, and in any case, you may traverse it going to and from parts of the Old city.

So much to see and do all around this square. I was surprised that there was so much space in this old part of the city. The main tourist attractions are around this square..the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia Museum and the Basilica Cistern with the Grand Bazaar a short walk away.
A great place just to sit and people watch.
A quick walk through. Great people-watching square. Stop by on your way to the other major attractions in the area. It was very crowded when we were there but, alas, very interesting.
The flavor of Istanbul.. Where the locals hang and the souvenir galore can be found. Safe and lively area of Istanbul. You will be able to find everything here.

In the middle of it all. Sultanahmet square is right in the middle of the old city.... right in the middle of most things you must see. There's a garden with the Sultanahmet Mosque (Blue mosque) on one side and Haghia Sofia on the other. Across the road is the entrance to the Basilica Cistern, beside the mosque is the Hippodrome. There are restaurants, shops, historical sights, trams on the roads and the Topkapi palace is just nearby.This is where it all is....

One of my favorites in Istanbul. Great place to people watch, eat corn, and Turkish ice cream, use the WC, and enjoy the sunshine. Also a great place to listen to the call to prayer bothe the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque have evocative calls.

An excellent place to visit and relax. We ending up here every day since we were using the big bus and found this place very relaxing and fun to visit. Awesome photos and views, gets crowded but seems fine since its so big.
nice place. Gorgeous square surrounded by Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace. Also nice to just sit and people watch.
The Old City in Istanbul. The square was clean and tidy with lots to see and do. It is the hub for visiting the Blue mosque , Topkapi Palace and Cistern. Close to good eating places.

Enjoyable and a Nice Place to People Watch. Great to just walk around. If you're an early bird and a runner/walker, you will definitely enjoy the mornings there. The evenings are very nice as well w/the mosques lit up and the fountain too. Some of the souvenir shops have good prices.

The Centre of historic Istanbul. A lovely place to visit both during the day and at night when all the historic sites are floodlit. There is not really that much in the square itself (a fountain) but with the Blue Mosque at one end and the Hagia Sofia at the other, the hippodrome and Basilica Cistern behind and views of the Bosphorus to the front, it is easy to see why the place is so popular. As well as all this you are just two minutes walk from the Topkapi palace and less than 10 minutes from the Grand BazaarThere are a few places to eat in the square itself and numerous restaurants and hotels in the surrounding streets.The square really is the centre point of all there is to see in the historic Sultanahmet district so it deserves a good Tripadvisor score.

ISLAMIC HISTORY. I Love to go to this square, .it is full of history consist of many Ahsabies may pece upon them ,many other histirical attractions.the food in this square is excellent espically chopes.many shopping facilities ,every sort of thing is available best transporation system.

Feel happy have fresh air. You have to go there everyday.Very large area . people are moving around all the time because many historic attractions are in the neighbourhood. Chestnut trees are all around. You can enjoy the ice cream, chestnuts and corn.Water ponds many sitting places are available to sit and enjoy.
Sultanahmet Park - Great for Pics!. Very pretty place and great to take some photos! Be sure to walk around the fountain as there are some beautiful mosaicssurrounding it!
Good for photography. Nothing to describe specifically. The stalwart buildings such as Hagia Sophia museum, the blue mosque etc in the background makes this place ideal for photo shoots for tourists.
great place. The place where the action is on. Must be at this place to see all monuments and attaractions of Istanbul city.

Great locale. Gorgeous square surrounded by so much history. A centrepoint for various interesting historical sites, such as the Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace. Also nice to just sit and people watch.

A Must visit place in Istanbul. Lovey square with views of Hagia Sophia and Blue mosque. Fantastic place to relax and take your holiday pictures. Its frequented by tourists and expect to see people from different countries. Lots of hawkers and street food carts are there to make your stay more enjoyable. There is a water fountain which looks lovely at night with lighting. In addition, various monuments are located nearby to be checked out.

Sultanahmet Square - The Confluence of Turkish Heritage and Culture. Sultanahmet Square located in the Old City is the most popular centre in Istanbul. It is around this Square that the most prominent and iconic heritage of the Ottoman Empire could be found and the most busiest location as most tourist buses and Hop On Hop Off bus will begin and terminate their travel from this Square. Around the Square and slightly away we can find the most important historical places to visit as follows:[1] The Blue Mosque standing majestically with 6 minarets [only the Blue Mosque has 6 minarets] whereas others may have four, two or even one to represent the importance and status of the mosque in the community,The Blue Mosque is an operational Mosque and open daily from morning to evening except during prayer times. On Friday it is open from 2 pm onwardsand close prior to that to give way to Friday prayer in the afternoon.[2] Aya Sofia or Haghia Sophia - one of the top destination in Istanbul. It was once a Church during the Byzantine era and when the Ottoman conquered Istanbul or Constantinople at that time, the Church was converted into a Mosque. It was later in this Century that Haghia Sophia was converted into a Museum for everyone to have a look. Some of the original paintings on the wall are still visible as the Ottoman did not destroy them, instead covered it with plaster,[3] Basilica Cistern - A water reservoir to serve the water need of Istanbul built during the Roman Empire. The place has been renovated several times and a walking platform has been built to make it more convinient for visitors to walk and enjoy the magnificient heritage,[4] Museum Topkapi. This is the most crowded place and a major attraction. The Museum was once a Palace where the Ottoman Empire was administered for several hundred years. Amongst the most famous items to see are the big diamond and paraphernalia used by Prophet Muhammad SAW [peace upon him] and several other caliphates. One has to queu for hours just to get a glimpse of some of the artifacts. It will need at a day or two to cover meaningful artifacts.[5] Next to the Square we can also find Arista Bazaar, a much orderly bazaar in comparison to the Grand Bazaar and easier to shop with less bargaining done.In the centre of the Square there is water fountain and from this point tourists mostly take photographs with the background of either The Blue Mosque or Haghia Sophia. There are other monuments sucha s pillar standing tall brought from Egypt and a structure donated from the Kaiser of Germany to commemorate the friendship of Germany and Turkey.Sultanahmet Square is the most lively Square day and night as it remains the centre point for all activities related to the heritage of the Ottoman Empire and a place which cannot be missed by any tourist visiting Istanbul and Turkey.Saharudin & MariamVisiting September 2015Reporting 06.10.2015

Perfect starting point. Great spot for easy walking to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, tram, hop on - hop off bus, restaurants........all within this square.....minutes walk from each other.

Imagine chariots racing round 2 furlongs up and back. Situated between the blue mosque and the situation Hagia the square ghas lovely fountains and is at the top end of the old hippodrome. Loads of culture , museums, site within two minutes along with a nice bazaar behind the blue mosque , the to okapi palace five minutes walk away. It should be central to your planning for days in istanbul

Great place to rest and soak in the city. A wonderful surprisingly peaceful oasis in the middle of a bustling city. Even the constant road noise disappears. Best seen at night when floodlights hit the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the fountains. Absolutely brilliant.

mingle with the locals. Feel like strolling, having some icecream? This is the place. Relax, watch the monumental Ayasofy and mingle with the locals. This square is clean, safe and offers a wonderful scenary for your fotos.
Nice. This is a nice little square to sit and people watch, right in the middle of all the attractions. lots of benches
Sultanahmet the place to be in Istanbul. A lovely square with Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia Museum and some obelisks. Can be crowded at times but great tourist attraction.

A must see when in Turkey. Wonderful experience. Lots of tourists, but thankfully we saw it. Go early if you are visiting as we were advised, and in looking back at a later stage the lines were extremely long.

Must do in Old Istanbul. There are a number of attractions to see in the general area of the Square....all a must see if you are at all interested in the fascinating history of Istanbul...the Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, the Hippodrome, the Basilica Cistern, the German Fountain & Topkapi Palace. It is a very busy area but easily accessible by the cities tram system or even on foot....it joins onto laneways filled with eateries & small shops & is also a major stop on the hop-on-off bus tour....try to get there early if you want to attempt to avoid the enormous queues that form at these attractions later in the day. Word to the wise though...beware of the carpet salesmen that haunt this area...be polite but firm with them but do expect to be approached if you look even vaguely touristy!

Picturesque and intriguing square in Istanbul. We spent some time in the square and enjoyed the relaxed ambience of the area and the intrigue as it sat reverently in the shadows of the more prominent structures such as the blue mosque. Both Obolisks in the square are incredible to see

worth the vist not for the square, but for all the historic places around. to have at walking distance Haghia Sophia, blue mosque, the underground cistern and the Topkapi palace makes Sultanhamet square a great place to visit and take pictures
Stunning. The perfect place to soak up the atmosphere of Istanbul, the people, the architecture, the history...loved this square.
Take time off from hectic sight seeing to relax here. Want to relax in the serene views of history spread around you? Just sit and relax in the Blue square..
Good to spend the day. A fun place to spend time.Plenty of restaurants to try, great sweets, street food and all next to the major historical attractions in Istanbul.
A must See Location. Nice spot to sit and watch the people going about their day, whether it is fellow travellers or locals touting for business.

Great Spot. Nice place to set and relaxed observing life of Istanbul with many tourist
The square having great collection of green and old buildings
Go and bask in history.. Excellent place to visit if you can avoid the touts and assorted salesmen. The square is very clean and tidy.

lovely spot. this square in between the blue mosque and aya sofya is a great place to sit and people watch. the fountain and flowers are lovely and there are plenty of places to get a meal or a drink.
Full of life. Lies between the Blue mosque and Haghia Sophia a green square with lots of activities where locals and tourists meet .Worth seeing any time

amazing place. lost of resturants and cafes
good relaxing to watch The blue mosque and Hagia Sophia with a glass of tea or a cuo of turkish coffee
fountain with amazing clours at night

Goosebumps. This was the highlight of Istanbul to me. Sitting between the Blue Mosque and AyaSofya, looking at the fountain and the people and listening to the prayers/chanting between the two Mosques was a deeply moving experience!

A park among great monuments!. Probably the best location for a park. Between Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, offers not only incredible view, but also a place for relaxation. You can just sit on a bench and enjoy the beauty

Beautiful. Our hotel was nearby so we spent a lot of time passing through here or just sitting. It is a really vibrant busy zone. One evening I watched 4 boys play soccer in a little grassy area in front of the blue mosque. The fountain changes colors and makes the Hagia Sophia take on a different tint. It was beautiful. A great place for people watching.
Nice place to relax. A popular place to hang out - you can sit by the fountain and admire the Hagia Sofia or turn the other way and admire the Blue Mosque. Not too bad a way to spend a little time

Grand Square flanked by Sultan Ahmet Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The Sultan Ahmet Square is impressive indeed with the 'Blue Mosque' - Sultan Ahmet Mosque on one side and the Hagia Sophia on the other side. The square itself is a good place to relax and great for photo-ops.

See the possible inspiration for Ben Hur's Chariot Race. This area is the hub of tourists visiting Istanbul, especially if you are only there for a day or so. From here you have access to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and the Hippodrome. The local tram comes to Sultanahmet from the other side of the Galata bridge, tram number 1 and so this makes it accessible for cruise passengers who want to do their own thing. The Hippodrome is worth a visit as it could have been the inspiration for the chariot race in the film Ben Hur. It is an elongated open area with obolesisks along its axis. There are interpretive boards in English and other languages located at its main features. It is worth stopping there on your way to the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia. The Topkapi is slightly further from the Square but is still accessible for most people with average walking ability.

Wonderful Square in the Sulanahmet District. Sultanahmet Square is located in the centre of the Sultanahmet area and is a great area to take in the sights. It gives you a great view of the Blue Mosque and surrounding attractions. The fountain in the centre is actually wonderfully lit up at night and a beautiful sight.

Magical ambiance...... Be sure to visit this enchanting square both in the daytime and at night (extremely safe).The well-kept gardens (palm trees and floral beds), the dancing fountains (change colour at night), views of the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia (particularly magical in the evening when all lit up) , the colourful carts/kiosks selling roast corn, chestnuts and simit, families enjoying time in the open.....all create a magical ambiance.The square is so central to all the historical sights in Sultanahmet and there are many eateries (several visited by Turkish families), currency bureaus (however, exchange rates are not as good as in the Grand Bazaar) and Turkish delight shops.The square is also the main terminus for the hop on and off red buses and the tram (very modern and efficient) station is nearby, too.Worth several visits to soak up the atmosphere......

Where Istanbul makes a great first impression!. Located between the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, two of Istanbul's iconic buildings and biggest attractions, this open space is the perfect first-stop for visitors to the city: get your bearings and shake off the jet-lag as you wander around the square in the sunshine. Photographs of the rear of the Blue Mosque are best in the morning while those of the front facade of the Hagia Sofia are best in the afternoon due to the position of the sun.

Turkey is interesting but we did not go inside palaces since fee is very high. Its the most vibrant tourist place . Do not buy Baklava . It is hopeless.Turkey is interesting but we did not go inside palaces since fee is very high

Exciting, different and bustling with people. This was a must see place for travelers to take in the local people and see how they live and eat. There are restaurants, hotels all around. Shopping for Turkish sweets and site seeing are all here.
Take time out. Great place to just 'hang out' with the locals, and experience the overall feel of the area before heading off to explore the city

Best place for photos. From here you can see both Ayasophia and Blue Mosque. The idea place for picture of the two famous Istanbul icons. But, expect tons of people. Go at late afternoon or evening time. Less crowded, and better light for photos.
Perfect Starting Point in Istanbul. wonderful place to meet and start. Right next to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. And a lovely square. Easy to get to with public transportation
HISTORIC BLUE MOSQUE. Beginning of Ottoman Empire - early visit to avoid large crowds. Architecture is so breathtaking. Lovely.
Make an early visit. Stop and wonder. I visited with a camera befor 7 in the morning, amazing views and so quiet before the mass tourists arive and the sites open

Must visit location. Plenty of things to do, places to eat. Lots to see. Great place to visit. On a hot day it can be quite exposed unless you are sheltering in a restaurant or in the mosque / church. Lots of history here in this great city.

People watch!. Great place to people watch. Got chatting to several Turkish people (not all from Istanbul) and discussed everything from Grandchildren (very popular) to politics (interesting) and of course food (very interesting). Great people, wonderful buzz about the place, surrounded by history and plenty of places to eat and drink. What more can you want!

Very picturesque. This is a great place to take some really nice photos and relax while moving around the Hippodrome, Hagia Sofiya and the Blue mosque.
It makes for a really nice place to take some photos too, so be sure to stop by for 10 mins and take a few photos.
Nice park. Large park running between Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Lots of vendors selling food and drinks. Beautiful flowers.
Central tourist area. Excellent place to start tour on hop on bus and view mosques. Great place for pictures. restaurants near.

Gotta See it!. I didn't really want to go to Istanbul, but we did it to please my wife.
Well, I could not have been more wrong. Well worth the visit.
A great place to just hang out!. This, in my opinion, is the place to just sit back and relax and soak up the experience of being in Istanbul.

Moments of peace. I much enjoyed staying there early in the morning..Between aya sophia and blue mosque ..... buying Semit.... feeding birds ...having a cup of sehlep ...Simply enjoying a morning at Istanbul ♥
Feel the History life.... Its a great nice area, old beautifulll, Haghia Sopia, Bule mosc, German Fountain, Obelisk, Mozaik Museum, Topkapı palast is there finadble, really stunning place.

Must visit in Istanbul. We visited Sultanahmet Square during day as well as at night time. We were impressed with the both. During day there is a buzz of tourists. But at the night the locals comes around water fountain to enjoy lights and allow the kids to run around. Lovely place.

vanity fair. a very interesting place...the place where many Istanbul sights can be seen ,,,Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque, remnants of ancient Hippodrome...everything is gathered at this spot; it is especially beautiful late in the evening, when locals and tourists fill te square...it is like a small museum in the open air and at the same time the place where people come to enjoy the beauty of these wonderful sights and relax, have a cup of delicious Turkish coffee, or simply taste roasted maize or chestnut...
Go, go !!!!. Very beautiful square. Located between Hagia Sofia and blue mosque with nice fountain, bench . People seat around. Perfect place to relax)))

Tough to beat the view of the mosques, the grounds and all the people. This is one of the first places we walked to on our first morning in Istanbul. The area between the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque has places to sit and view the two structures, as well as watch the people go by.

Istanbul is amazing. Go to the square at sunset. Find a nice seat and wait for the call to prayer -- you'll hear the muzzin turn on the microphone. Watch the sunset and listen to the call. Think back on how many times this scene has been repeated throughout time. Watch as this secular and lively city lights up and the tourists start to see the locals going home from work, or out on an evening stroll in the night air. Take a scoop of ice cream and just enjoy the moment.

Wonderful open space. It is a very enjoyable square, since it is close to the Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Hamams, Topkapi and other sites. The green spaces and flower beds are very attractive; benches are available and some restaurants with lots of outdoor seating. It's enjoyable to spend some time there, if anly to people watch.
Square with a lot of history. On one side Hagia Sofia, on the other Blue Mosque. In the middle fountains, monuments and flowers. A magical place both during the day and at night with lights lit
wonderful and relaxing. Very nice place to just hang out with friends or family. It has a very relaxing atmosphere, but very bustling with tourists!
Cool views. Amazing views all around from the square of Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque easily accessible by public transport

Where it all happens. Flowers, shady trees, benches to sit on, clean, street food available, ice cream..... sleepy dogs resting in the shade and even a few cats wanting to be pet! What a lovely place to hang out, great atmosphere.
Relax. Great place to relax and take in the amazing views of Istanbul. Plenty of attraction near here and a good central place to hang out.
Relaxing spot in Istanbul. This is the center of most of the historical attraction in Istanbul. Just sit here and enjoy the view of Aya Sophia and The Blue MOsque. U cant go wrong coming here

Don't take a taxi from here!. Avoid taking a taxi straight from Sultan Ahmed square to your hotel! These are tourist traps who will make detours or work with a doctored meter to significantly overcharge you! Rather ask for a taxi in a nearby cafe.
place of two religions. nice relaxing place with the view on two important historical buildings. rare place where you can see two different important relgious buildings so near to each other.

A place to stop and rest awhile .... This is a lovely square - the perfect place to stop and take a rest. There is lawn and there are lots of trees and benches around the fountains which are very attractive in themselves. I sat and enjoyed watching life going by while my friend went to Hagia Sophia where the queue was very much shorter than the one for the Blue Mosque close by. She found Hagia Sophia to be very beautiful and well worth a visit. The shop prices are slightly lower than elsewhere because it is a museum shop. I did my best shopping in the area around the square. I found fabulous little gift shops, well stocked and with prices on everything - good prices! My favourite: Hippodrome 111. Oh what a boon, after being subjected to the shops around our hotel where nothing was priced and we were accosted with smiles and apple tea and then treated so rudely when we chose not to buy! You can have fun shopping in Istanbul but you can get quickly fleeced too if you don't know your product and your prices.
Best photos. Best pictures of blue mosque and Aya Sophia, relaxing area, best pictures during the night. Good street food.

Nice place to relax and people watch. Blue Square is an easy-to-find place for meeting people, for dining from the street carts or the many cafes located nearby, and for people watching. It is very close to the Sultanahmet train stop. Beware of extremely fast drivers of autos and buses who often don't slow down for pedestrians, even those on sidewalks. There are many sleeping dogs in the grass which didn't appear to be bothering anyone. I didn't encounter any beggars as has been mentioned in previous reviews. Enjoy the benches, the grass, the fountain, and the views!
impressive. Impressive and beautiful indeed! Obligatory for any Istanbul visitor. Looks best from the outside in my opinion, but its free to enter.
Very beautiful and relaxing place. We just loved sitting there and doing nothing at all. It was great being surrounded by amazing historical places and so many interesting people.
It was a nice walk!. Never get bored while walking. Streets are fully with the lights and music. its truly enjoyable. ..................

Quintessential Istanbul . When you're standing in Sultanahmet Square looking between Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque, with the muezzins sounding the call to prayer, you realise you're truly in Istanbul. Has to be done. I could talk about the handy tram/metro access, the stalls to buy food/drink and the other amenities but, really, that's not the main thing. It's got to be done regardless. Also really nice to see Istanbul residents gather and sit on the grass in the evenings.

Great view and park.. Great view and park. The are quite a few tourist objectives in the area. Some free (like staring at the old Serpent and Egyptian Columns) some with entrance fee (like Hagia Sophia).

We liked just sitting here to enjoy this beautiful city. We came here several times to find a street vendor for good yummy food. The people that came here were fun to watch. We liked just sitting here to enjoy this beautiful city
By evening too. Chill out zone if the history or the sun gets too heavy. Just sitting here too can get alot of history into you.
Historic Attraction. Visit the fantastic and beautiful mosque with its impressive blue ceramic. Enjoy the garden outside. Haga Sofia is a couple of minutes walk away.
Enjoy the beauty around you. beautiful views, fun people watching, good place to rest and just take in all the beauty around you.

Sultanahmet Square.. This the Square between Hagia Sophia and the blue Mosque. For me the these are most beautiful buildings in the word and I could sit there all day just looking at those two. Because of those two attractions and also the Topkapi Palace nearby it does get busy. It's nice to sit there in the late afternoon. Also you have the tram stop there.

Nice place. such a nice place to spend time.. even at night with the colorful fountain.. only problem I had was the large numbers of dogs (they were not harmful at all).. be careful of people trying to sell you trips and packages here, one of them tricked me using the famous banknote change scam

Beautiful Square and meeting place. Surrounded by the best attractions in Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern etc), the Sultanahment Square is a great place to meet, or get some food or just have a sit and enjoy the view of these historical landmarks before embarking on your next experience.

Try and be here when call to prayers occur. The square is a relaxing, large & pleasant area to idle away time between visiting local attractions & mosques. When the imams call the faithful to pray, it is stunning - and very loud! But, oh so memorable.

Great Spot to take some photos and get a bite to eat.. The square provides excellent spots for taking pictures of both Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Food vendors and outdoor restaurants are also nearby.

a long list of things to do on your feet. This is one of the busiest places in Turkey with a long list of attractions side by side. You will need 2 full days on your feet , trust me! Don’t use any transportation between those attractions! You don’t need them!!!1. Start with Sultan Ahmet Bazar. Expensive, but higher quality items to buy with some old style coffee shops and restaurants ..... 2. Then WALK towards the Blue Mosque ( Sultan Ahmat Mosque)... make sure not to go during prayers time....3. Then WALK to Hagia Sophia Museum,4. From there walk again towards TOPKAPI palace..... 5. From TOPKAPI palace you can walk to Basilica Cistern / just across the street..... it's the yellow building on the other corner!.... 6. From there you can walk for half a mile or so towards grand bazar 7. Then it's up to you to go from there down towards Spices bazar through Mahmoud basa street ( one of the most crowded and cheapest streets in Istanbul ) Never go with tourists groups , otherwise your time will be wasted waiting and waiting. discover it yourself, on your feet!..... grab you selfie and enjoy discovering this part of the city....TIP: Don't trust anybody offering you any kind of service in this part of the city….. you don’t need any help…

Picnicking and people watching. Contemplate what you have seen plan your next option. Escape expensive restaurants and enjoy a picnic under a tree watching the world go by along with the locals. Its very clean and cold water, roasted corn and bread at a minimum will be dotted around for your convenience.

Istambul is one of the places that one has to visit at least once in a life time.. A place full of exotic arquitecture and ancient history. The combination of modern with ancient gives the city a unique character. It is a place in which east and west meet.

Interesting all around. The square gives a perspective on many of the attractions one wants to visit. A 360 degree view heads you toward many interesting sites including several mosques, interesting shops, several palaces, and more. This is a pretty place to visit day or night.

a fabulous place to wander around. A great place to wander,, there are plenty of corn on the cob, and spit ( a bread product), both 1¥TY. from the square you can visit the blue mosque, little Sophia mosque and Topakimpalace
Sultanahmet mosque. one of best palace for tourist and visitor, the traditional malls of Istanbul is here. the Sultanahmet mosque is one the greatest mosque that i see
People Watching at its Finest. Just sit here and people watch, that's half the fun. Gorgeous view of Hagia Sofya on one side, Blue Mosque on the other.

One of the most relaxing places in Istanbul. This squares sits right between the Blue Mosque (Sutanahmet) and the Hagia Sofia, and it brings tourists from all over the world. Take a seat by the fountain, listen to the prayer calls ring between both the Hagia Sofia, and the Blue Mosque. See paper lanterns launched at night (though not every night) and enjoy a rooftop terrace (of which there are seemingly thousands) overlooking the vast city of Istanbul.
Beautiful. The place is really beautiful. Many nice restaurants nearby. Just a great place to relax and plenty of tourists here as well.

One of best mosque in Istanbul. One of best places in Istanbul , if you love history you should visit this mosque , after that you can walking historical places around it , also there is a wonderful musium there , dont forget to visit it too,

Lovely square leading to top attractions.. It was nice to be able to sit and take in the blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. There we plenty of chestnut/corn on the cob vendors. Also there are some lovely eateries if you walk up the hill following the tram line. It is at the edge of the square that you pick up the hop on hop off bus. There were stray dogs looked after by the city that appear to live in the square. and the tram.
Perfect blues inside mosque. Must see square and blue mosque if you go to istanbul note the carpets in the blue mosque where the tulip prints are is where one places their knees arms and forehead

great place to walk around. great place to walk around - it is located between Blue Mosque and Aya Sofiya. There are some benches where you can seat and listen for call for prayers from both mosques at the same time
Room to move. Great meeting place from here you have access to the major attractions. Allow a couple of hours as there is so much to see and take in.
Must see. A great ancient place with many attractions, and proximity to many sites that are worth seeing. Easy accessibility.
Nice to have open space, busy, and mainly for access to sites. It's quite a nice open space but it's primarily an access point to the monument sites around it. Very busy but tram stop right there
Beautiful!. It was a beautiful day to visit the Square. Anywhere you look, you see something of importance and beauty.
Good to hang out. Perfect place to hang out with friends as there are lots of hotels/clubs, restaurants and shops around the square. Volume of people I've seen here.
A photographer's dream. Beautiful gardens surrounding the Blue Mosque. Be sure to bring your camera, plenty of great photographic sights.

Great resting and watching. Take a seat to catch your breath between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Watch the touts trying to show their carpets, the tourists, the brides and others. An restful place with fountains and trees,

Very busy place. The Sultanahmet Square is a good place to sit and watch life go by. At one end is the Blue Mosque, and the other Agia Sofia, so great for taking photos. This is where all the tour buses off load, so it can become very congested.

Just sit and take it in.. So much to see. So much history. So many people. Get yourself a cold drink from one of the vendors in the square and sit somewhere in the shade trying to take it in. Looking at the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and all the people is something that will stay with you for a long time.
beautiful and historical sultanahmet!. i always love coming back to sultanahmet!....busy busy streets historical sights lots see!.... wonderful stores and very easy to get around!

Good resting area between tourist attractions.. A fun place to sit and rest between Aya Sofia, Topkapi palace and Blue Mosque. There are some benches around the fountains and many benches in front of the Blue Mosque. Rest rooms, ATM and food available in this area. The fountains are lit up at night.
Amazing. Amazing place to walk around, near to most historic places in Istanbul. There are many restaurants and cafes around.

Sultanahmet District. Lots to see and photograph, day and night. This is the real heart of the tourist area, walkable between all major sites. Go early to beat the queues, Topkapi Palace is closed on Tuesdays.

You can spend your whole day here without getting boared!. A very crowded yet safe place with perfect view of the old mosques. Kids friendly. Lots of benches to sit on and enjoy the nice view.Turkish tea and ice cream, boiled and barbecued corns and all types of snacks and meals availabe all around you!

Wonderful area!. What an amazing place to walk around! I think being in the Sultanahmet Square on a Saturday evening was my favorite part of our vacation. The whole square is beautiful day or night. In the evening it is lit up, and the fountain is lit up in different colors. Everything looks so cool.There are all different types of people here enjoying their free time. We saw people in shorts and tank tops, people wearing head scarfs, and people in full burkas all in the same area. Everyone seemed to get along, and everyone was impressed by the sites.

Not much this year!. This year was my 4th visit to Istanbul I used to stay in this district as I like the area very much and this park was one of the most attraction places to me during my previous visits but unfortunately this year it was so disappointing, this place turned to a very dirty place and all flowers gone , I do not know the actual reason!
Very nice place. This place is full of nice places to see or just sit down and relax. Near to most historic places in sultanahmet district. Very highly recommended.
Beautiful Park!. We love this park. It is so beautiful !!! The garden was so stunning ! We took a lot of pictures when we were there.

Lovely During the Day, But Better at Night. Very active area during the day, but really wonderful at night. Just strolling the square is a lovely experience. So many families just enjoying the night air and the fountains. And the Blue Mosque lit up at night is beautiful-totally different look than during the daylight hours. I just loved it.
Safe. Sultanahmet square is one of the most safe and beautifull square on the earth..You have somuch history to see and its close to every attraction to walk.

Magical, day and night.. This IS Istanbul. Standing between Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Camii), well, what's not to like??? Just keep spinning. Every way you look is stunning, exotic, historical, beautiful, awe-inspiring. . . and on and on.If you only had 30 minutes to spend in Istanbul in your life, this is where you would want to be. Especially at dusk/night or early morning. I experienced both.I took the train/subway to the tram to the Sultanahmet stop from Ataturk Airport (It took 40-45 minutes, but I would allow an hour. And remember to buy two tokens or 4 for a round trip). I arrived just at about sunset. The first thing you see off the tram is the Blue Mosque straight in front of you. You think you've died and gone to heaven until walk forward a few steps and notice Hagia Sophia off to your left. And then you know you're in heaven. It's breathtaking.As dusk descended and the lights on the mosques and the dancing fountain took over, it went from photographers dream to photographers nirvana. It's lit up better than Epcot only. . . . . IT'S REAL!!!Of course I went into the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia the next morning (all this on a 21 hour lay-over for my flight. . . buy a visa online before you go.), but if I had just made it to the Square and then had to go home, I would have been very satisfied.

Normal square. It's a normal square , you have there a lot of people selling "simitis", grilled corn and tours.The best part on the square it's the shadows. In istambul there are people eating on the streets everywhere, and because it's a very hot city, you see a lot of families apreciating the shadows and eating.It's possible to see there the Aya Sophia Musk

The beating of heart of Istanbul. We spend most evening here as it has such a great atmosphere. There are a few restaurant nearby Dervish, we loved, especially the one where they have live music, sheisha and a whirling dervish! Fantastic
Nice area. This is a nice square where families can be found picnicking and is a good spot to take pictures. You can also do a little shopping.

Very good. it is a alive square for 24 hours, one corner Hagiasofia, one corner amazing Sultanahmet Mosque, other corner a historical Place from Byzantium and last corner full of restaurants, must visited except ruh hours,don't use taxi use public transportation.

Make sure to visit in the evening. I visited this place in the day and at night because my hotel was just around the corner. The park is located right in the heart of the Sultanahmet area. I would suggest visit in the evening when the temperature drops a bit and as the nearby attractions are illuminated, it becomes a sight to behold
Favorite place of tourists. One of my favorite places in Istanbul. A lot to see in this area; mosques, museums, bazaars, restaurants with delicious local food, etc

Pass through in the day and saunter in the evening. Sultanahmet Square tends to be packed with tour groups during the day, exponents of selfies abound, oblivious to others attempting to pass, and independent tour guides importune all passers-by. Nonetheless the gardens and fountains are attractive, and the entire area provides a perfect location for photographs of the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque. In thecevening, when the fountains are illuminated, and the crowds diminish it is a delight to wander in the Square.
Sofia Hagia, the Blue Mosque, Baisilica Cisterna and Topkapi.. Sofia Hagia, the Blue Mosque, Baisilica Cisterna and Topkapi. All there are a stone throw away from this magnificent square.
Ottoman on top of Byzantium. The mix of Byzantine and Ottoman influences in the Square are fascinating. We were very impressed by how clean the area is kept.
Beautiful. Great park for a rest with beautiful trees, flowers and cafe with restroom. Spend some free time resting between sites.

Centre of the tourist district. High proportion of the antiquities are within walking distance of this square, the Blue Most, the Agia Sophia church the Palace and the cisterns and all around the square. There is a very good tram system which frquently passes through the square, so it is a good idea to find out if it passes your hotel and how it works and is very cheap.

Tourist BEWARE the beggars may not be Syrian refugees. I have to comment on the beggars in the Square this year. I have been coming for 8 years to Istanbul and until now this wasn't a problem. I will include photos to document my point of view. There are people pretending to be Syrian refugees begging and sleeping on the street with a money box next to them. One boy I took to the tourist police and to the police had been there on three days consecutively. What Mother leaves their child to sleep on the street? Help the children, they wont be used if you don't give money. Don't give money to beggars. Children should be in school in Turkey. The mosques help the poor so Tourist BEWARE help yourself and them, make a donation at your favorite mosque. This year the tourists are down and many people from Turkey are visiting. Its nice to see the square well used. I love the view of the Blue Mosque and The Aye of Sophia. Very close to the Arasta Bazaar and that was a treat. It was low key no aggressive sight seeing and shopping authentic Turkish goods, spices, scarves, jackets, shoes and handbags.

peace and calm. nice place to rest, get there with big bus tours, toilets with extra fees, dogs are sleeping in the street but not harmful they even play with cats , not that much to do as shopping or night life

Stunning. We traveled here on the open top bus. it was very hot...
just stayed and viewed the out side and ate ice cream before getting back on bus...
Lots to see while you sit in the shade. We sat in the square on several occasions eTing kebab or ice cream. On one occasion there was a marching band that performed in the arena
Spend time with family. this is great place where you can spend your time with family in day, evening or at night time. i mostly visited this at night as it looks more beautiful in the night.
Great place to relax. Lovely area with coffee and tea, corn and bread vendors. Great views and delightful 'people watching' area.
Take the time. To see such fantastic examples of mosques and there beauty worth the time and easy to get to and near the markets
Relaxing. A very nice experience. Specially went to pray in the blue mosque with kids. the square is a nice calm and quiet place to roam around.
vacation. this area is the best clean the Mosques are beautiful dogs and cats are running free here and it is still very clean. Turkish people are very friendly
A square in between two famous attraction of Istanbul. Its a nice place to hangout while enjoying the view of the two main attraction in sultanahmed, Istanbul.

Lovely views. Breathtaking views here. Lots of scenery here. Make sure you have a 1$ Turkish to use the public restrooms which are clean and kept. We took the big red bus (hop on and off) from here and toured the city.
Stunning. Worth seeing during the day and at night, it's a very lively area, lovely just to sit in a restaurant there and watch the world go by most are open until the early hours of the morning.

Must visit.. Have comfortable clothes and shoes, camera and water.
Try the food.
Have company with you, boring when alone.
Blue Mosque - beautiful and an honor to see this. Beautiful area, but the trees are too tall and cover up the Blue Mosque; if you walk around towards Arasta Bazaar, you can get some better pictures.

Excellent!. Wonderful square! One can walk around the square, there are food options, and you can also take in the excellent sites! The square is also very nice to walk around in during the evening following dinner
Surrounded by giants. The area is somewhere you can rest between venturing through the various historic giants of sultanehmet that surround it.
A good place to rest. The Square has wonderful places to eat delicious food plus it is close to the Hippodrome and the Egyptian obelisk,Hagia Sophia,Blue Mosque,Topkapi.etc.Great to take pics!
JUST PERFECT.. when you decide to visit istanbul, make sure you go to sultanahmet square to see the marvelous and amazing building, mosques BUT make sure you dont get decived by trip seller

Great place to spend summer evenings!. We spent most of our evenings here, the place was buzzing with tourists and locals like. We just sat at one of the benches, watched the sun go down and helped ourselves to some sut misir(roasted corn on the cob)

Chill out. My wife and I enjoyed the rest in between the places we visited and enjoyed a freshly squeezed pomegranate juice. The pictures you can take are also worth it. We took a short break to catch our breath and start again our visiting journey. As this was the purpose of our touristic visit to Istanbul. Recommended.

Enjoy a quiet morning there. We stayed in a hotel near the square. So we passed by the square very often. The best time to visit the square is before 8:00am when there are no tours. It's cool and calm out there even when it's in early August when we were there. Visiting the square in the evening gives you another flavor. I often walked to the square early in the morning to enjoy the breeze of wind. Blue Mosque, Sofia Museum, and many other attractions are nearby. There are many nice restaurants and food stands too in or near the square.

Place to take a break between two landmarks. Great place to jump on the benches on top and take a picture with the blue mosque behind you. Also a great middle ground to take a break from learning about the blue mosque - eat something and exhale before going into Hagia Sofia.

Everything is here. The Square has markets and wonderful places to eat delicious foods plus is the site of the Roman Hippodrome and the Egyptian obelisk, Roman Serpent Spiral etc. Easy walk to the Blue Mosque (free entry) and Hagia Sofia (paid entry).

Stunning veiws of the blue mosque and hagia sophia, in a large open site. This square is surrounded by the blue mosque on one side, the great Hagia Sophia on the other side, and lines of cafe and restaurants on the opposite side. Always full of visitors, the base station of Istanbul Big-Bus tours, the pole of traditional restaurants, and a center of cultural and hostoric buildings.
A nice scenic and peaceful place. A nice scenic and peaceful place to visit with great views of both Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. For great views visit at night time as well
Ancient city. It is such a delight to see people enjoying this beautiful area, you grab the big red bus here also.
fun. all around you see the most popular historical places , ayah Sofia , the blue mosque , many restaurants around , clean

Historic centre. This is a wonderful spot and is really the heart of the historic centre. Many of the main attractions of the city are near here. It has a great atmosphere and is worth a visit at night as well when the sights are lit up and take on a magical quality. the Blue Mosque dominates and there are some great restaurants nearby as well as lots of benches to sit and take in the view.
of of top 5 places in Istanbul to visit. You can visit Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia museum and many great cafes there and walking is area is great

Sit down and while away the time. Nice area to sit and chill...in the evening i should add as it was far too hot during the day. Spent a few evenings here taking a leisurely stroll, eating an ice cream which with the right vendor, was a show in itself. Area was clean and safe.

good place to chill and take in the views. Istanbul is great to visit and the Sultanahmet Square embodies all that is good - just avoid tricksters who say they are giving you touristic advice but in reality want to lure you to their carpet shop
Unforgetable unique experience. Best place to observe the magnificence of Turkey and feel just a little of Turkish Sultans environment.

Wonderful place to see and nice place for rest if you are tourist. Wonderful place to see and nice place for rest if you are tourist. Square is between Sultanahmed mosque, Agia Sofia, Hurem Hamam and German fountain.

Spend an Hour Relaxing Here. Night time is perfect for wandering through this park or just sitting watching the world go by or enjoy the local cats being fed by local restaurant owners. The fountains are pretty with multi coloured lights highlighting the mosque behind.
Nice. Very nice place to vist many Resturants and Cafee musuem and walking eria special old hammam is there
Relaxed atmosphere. Spent a lot of time just hanging out here because it was relaxed and felt very safe. Also there is plenty to look at.
not good.... when you walking here alone many boys disturbing you its hard to walk alone many peoples disturbing you not good.
A Place to watch the world go by.. The square has the Blue Mosque, Haga Sophia, Basillica Cistern & the Turkish & Islamic Arts Museum. Lots of places to eat and benches to sit and relax.

Picturesque. Lovely place to relax and enjoy the best of Istanbul!
It was really nice to come here in the evening as well to see the fountain light up in multicolours.
Great place to take your photos!

Flower-beds, water features and benches.. For tourists this precinct is the heart of the Old City - sit on a bench and enjoy the views of the Blue Mosque to one side and the Aya Sofia on the other while surrounded by immaculate flower beds ablaze with flowers, and water features. And the tram station is right there if you want to go down to the water for a Balik Ekmek fish "sandwich"/roll. 8 Turkish lira.

Great photo op even in August. Even in a hot August timeframe the square looks lovely, is well maintained and makes a great photo op with the Blue Mosque in one direction and Haiga Sophia in the other.

Beautiful!. A beautiful location, nestled between the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Try and arrange to be there during the call to prayer- it is breathtaking and one of my favorite moments in Turkey...

Gorgeous Gardens. The Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque are pretty much across the street from each other and between them are gorgeous gardens with flowers and fountains. It is so beautiful and I cannot say enough nice things about this square.
Fountains at night. During the day it is a noisy place, but at night the fountains show up with colors and music. Good to see it.

Treasure of Sultanahmet. It is amazing how clean this park is. Whenever you walk by you get to enjoy the park and surrounding historical buildings. My kids love the fountain, and every time we come there, they must spend time around it. If you are there during ramadan (holy muslim month when people fast crack of dawn to sunset) expect the place to be busy all night long. It is very interesting, and we highly recommend it
A very wonderful place to spend time. The square is in the middle of it all. One of the best places to take pictures. You can take pictures of the Mosques or Fountains and get a quick snack
Must see!. Sultan Ahmet Square is BEAUTIFUL. During the spring and summer time, the path leading to the Camii has beautiful flowers! There are cafe, bathrooms in the park.

Magnificent. One of the most wonderful spots in Istanbul, standing there looking to Blue mosque on one side and Hagia Sophia on the other side ... Great. Also listening to Azzan from the mosques with Muezzins waiting for each other was Magnificent.

A walk and a good icecream. Beautiful place to take a walk and eat a traditional ice cream. It's filled with restaurants and coffe shops and close by you will find a nice hammam bath. It's also interesting when the ceremony from the Mosque starts and the people are being called inside.
Great sites to see. After visiting Ayia Sophia and Sultanahmet mosque, a very lovely place to rest and a beautiful park to be on a sunny day.
Great but pestered by offers of tours. We liked sultanahmet square with wonderful views of hagia Sophia and the blue mosque. The negatived we're the locals constantly asking us "do you want a tour"
Nice place to visit. Nice place to relax, The blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, and Gulhane park are all walking distance.

Beautiful!. Best to go towards evening because it might be sunny and hot. After that you can go and have a nice dinner at the restaurants around - close to the tram stop. It has a lot of historical buildings and attractions around.
Surprenant. Impersonate and sunny space. It deserves to see. We had visited it several times. We took pictures and enjoyed the space. The visited hours are accommodated. Don't miss it!
historical. breath-taking view with flock of tourist wondering around and eating at open space with happy mode n feeling

Best Square in Istanbul. A lot of outdoor activities can be found at this square. You can enjoy sitting and relaxing under the big old trees or you can enjoy a drink from a lot of small cafes spreads their or you can enjoy shopping from a lot of stores there.
Central. Sultanahmet Square is a central place to go to, great view, most of the attraction are in a walking distance.

Beautiful place to relax. We came here everyday as it was just around the corner from our hotel. It is a wonderful picturesque place where you can just relax and enjoy the views of the lovely sights around you. There are many restaurants and carts where you can purchase food and drinks, and for a cat lover like me ...this place has lots of cats just laying around so be prepared to be overwhelmed with their cuteness!

Open air park with plenty of history. This, seems to me, to be the center and heart of the Old City of Istanbul, and it is representative of the history of the entire area.On one end, is the Blue Mosque, on the other, is Hagia Sophia (a Church, turned Mosque turned Museum). The Hippodrome is an area within that Square, where chariot races and gladiator fights were held. Within the square, you've got an Egyptian obelisk, with it's own interesting story (we had a guide who had great stories and insights), as well as a Roman obelisk. The place continues to be a work in progress, as it has been throughout the ages.l A must-see while in Istanbul.

Beautiful square with gardens and fountains. I first went to this area at night, when the monuments and fountains were lit. That was a great first impression. Went back later several times during the day and and night; always felt clean, safe and vibrant. Many places to sit and chill, take in the view, and many carts snacks like selling corn on the cob and roasted chestnuts. Nice place to hang out and just relax.
Doves.. Nice doves. Some buildings and a kebab. Wherever i go i see doves looking at kebabs - aren´t they vegetarians? Stay away from cracks in the pavements, they shut you in.
Just beautiful.. Sit down somewhere and take it all in. The views, the sounds,the smells. The buildings are stunning.Enjoy.
a free activity that can't be missed. classit experience as one walks this historic square. street vendors and people watching make it a treat to enjoy

the pearl of Sultanahmet Area. the pearl of Sultanahmet Area
best where to go in Istanbul
live all day around
less buggers than Taksim Square
no more to say

Lovely place to stroll around...... Very nice square in Istanbul city center, is between Haghia Sophia and The Blue Mosque. Lovely gardens, few benches to sit and eat a treat or watching peolpe passing by.... and a fountain with light show at night...

Great experience . It was overwhelming the first day we visited the area but the following day we had a great feel of the place. The area is very populated with tourists and they have little stands selling corn and roasted chestnuts all around. The locals are very helpful and will gladly help you find your way around.
Very nice place. That is v ery interesting place to go. Beautiful around and many people are going there. Sitting around a nd spnding their times

Istanbul's one of the must visit site.. This is one of the beautiful sites in the middle of Istanbul city bustling with locals and visitors alike.
its worth visiting for an hour or so or more for history lovers. we spent 3 hours around Sultanahmet Square and was worth it. Absolutely recommended, though not for kids since nothing for them to do as such.

Great for strolling in the evening. Night time is the best time to visit the square. Full of families enjoying the summer evening and the coloured lights on the fountain. The mosques ar amazing at night..
Top people watching spot. Nice place to sit and enjoy the architecture and watch the world go by. Nice maintained grass area with seasonal flowers as well as park benches and food vendors.

Good but. It is a good place with full of people from different countries. The only problem is when I see with heartache is when some people are begging for money, sleeping on the grounds, walk dirty.

Beautiful Atmosphere!. This square is a gorgeous panorama of landmarks and the feel of Istanbul. My mother and I came during our layover. The train from the airport was crowded but fairly straightforward and the locals were plenty helpful.The square itself is a public area, free of charge. There are flocks of pigeons fluttering around, beautiful strange and very old trees, and plenty of interesting landmarks; The Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Obelisk are only some, to name. It is a mix of European and Arab and a non-miss. The whole thing is a photo opportunity. If you have time, I highly recommend having a traditional Turkish meal, but watch it! It can get pricey in that area. If you visit in winter, bring your gloves and jacket!! I left mine in the airport and nearly froze.

Get the multi-day pass to save money and bypass lines. Get the multi-day pass to bypass the lines. Get there early - but many of the historical sites are close together. If you go to the palace, allow plenty of time. We missed the kitchens and some of the sites. Arrive early, can get very crowded.

One of the most beautiful districts in Istanbul. Sultanahmet square is in between two breathtaking monuments. Hagia Sophia on the one side and Topkapi on the other. These are of the most visited tourist attractions in Istanbul. Worthwhile seeing and lots of space for children to run and enjoy themselves.

Great views of landmarks!. This square has many good views of the blue mosque and hagia Sophia from the outside. It also has many stands to purchase something to drink and eat. It gets crowded so watchout for pick pocketing, but other than that it is very good spot for pictures.

Sultanahmet Sq. After a hard day, or a evening meal
Great place to relax and unwind
Fountains, Views and Stalls
Highly recommended for all age groups, people watching or souvenir shopping. There are nearby places for a snack or a cool ice cream.
Must see. This is the square is right in front of the Haiga Sophia, making it a must see for your visit to Istanbul.
breathtaking. Very clean and beautiful square buzzing with culture and beautiful monuments. Everything is well kept and restored worth visiting and enriching.
The Blues. So lovely ambience with the view of the mosque with six minarates.. Big Gardens and Fountains... Lots of street musicians.. Great lighting in the evenings
The heart of Byzantine cililization.. It gives a wonderful overview of all several historical and architectural landmark sites around it..
historical square!. Enjoy some of the main tourist attractions by walk as they are very close by or catch the tram to explore other areas of the city.

A Must See Part of Istanbul. Be ware of some of the salesmen, however say no politely. Repeat if necessary and they will be polite back. The area is culturally great though. Restaurants and food are good.
