Worth the visit. It is one of the important "centers" of the city. Offers several sites for seeing, good food, and shopping. It is like a gateway to the past, a specially if you treat yourself for an unforgettable spa/bath treatment in Hurrem Sultan Hamam

Blue Mosque. It is a must see attraction.....so famous, an awesome view. Be respectful of the Muslims. You must cover knees and shoulders and the women must also cover their heads. Scarfs and wrap around are available. There is no charge but it is open only certain hours.

A must see in Istanbul. Beautiful square, which is placed in between Aghia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Even if you want to take some photos, its a great place, day or night. During April, when they have the tulip flower arrangements, its amazing.
nice place to walk around. Sultan Ahmet area is so lovely. you can spend great time there alone or with your family. Also you can try the traditional Turkish Hammam in that area.

A lovely place to visit while in Istanbul - Sultanahmet Square. A lovely place to visit while in Istanbul. As you wander from Mosque to Mosque or the Bazaars this is a tranquil place as you watch people queuing around you.
Everything you need to see is right there. Love this part of town. The big hitters are all around for attractions and it is easy to walk everywhere with great restaurants and hotels.

Feel good factor. Vast grounds, lots of people milling around most part of the day and late into night. Well kept grounds. Lots of places to buy snacks. Perfect for families. Cheerful and fun atmosphere.
Lovely Place. Very nice place to visit and walk around! must visit Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia! nice cafe for çay! beautiful gardens!

Must visit. A nice place to rest your feet and get a snack or a cold drink. You are surrounded by Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome with ancient monuments. It does not get much better in Istanbul. The "fine" bazaar is in the vicinity, as well as the cisterns, Hagia Eirene, the archeological museum, Topkapi Sarayi and much more. Street vendors galore, though.

Nice promenade area. Is a nice place to take a walk around it.You can try some baked chestnuts or a pretzel from the strolling vendors.It is located next to many landmarks like Grand Bazaar (across the street) , Blue Mosque and few others.Can be pretty crowded with many tourists sometimes.
Good for pictures, being in middle of Hagya Sophia and Blue Mosque. It is crowded and lively. Fountains are nice and it is generally clean. Another hang out spot and great for pictures.

Main attractions border the square. Main points to see in Istanbul border the square, Agia Sophia, Blue Mosque, hippodrome, the obelisks.
If you are in the Sultanameth sector, just walk, otherwise, use the tram, with frequent service from almost everywhere in the city.

beautiful open square with amazing museums and many restaurants. i just loved the side streets which were full of charming local eating places some simpler and some elegant.
there are many local shops and the famous mosques like Agia Sofia and the Sultan Ahmed are the main attractions here
Very Beautiful. The heart of the Sultanahmet District with Fountain Circle in the center surrounded by the Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sophia and the Basilica Cistern.
Orientation excursion from ship. Lots of history and architecture, I would have been just as happy with good pictures or a movie of the area.

Peace and quiet.. A lovely area just to sit and people watch. We were lucky enough to be there during a festival and watched hundreds of children performing the whirling dervishes dance/meditation. Quite a sight.
middle of historical places. It is great thing to stand in the middle of these historical places you can visit 10's of them more than one time

Favorite Square in all of Europe. Europe has its share of magnificent squares - arguably the best in the world. Sultanahmet Square is without question my favorite. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Egyptian Obelisks - it really doesn't get much better. Be sure to find a comfortable bench in the evening and just take it all in....perfection.
Very Central. It's very central to everything. I just loved to sit and watch people too. The markets were amazing and so very colourful

Very touristic area. Very busy, a lot of tourists, you can take fabulous photos, eat delicious food, relax on the grass or on the banks available everywhere.
Easy to access by tramway, the major touristic attractions are there.

The Square. We just had to see the Square where the protests took place regarding the Turkish President's wish to turn the 'people's' park into government buildings. It's a beautiful park that was well used and worth saving.

Where 2 big religions' landmarks meet. Full of history, beauty, architecture, charm, people. You can find people selling boat trips to Bosphorus strait. Worth to bargain with them as their prices are far better than the big travel agents'.

Midpoint between Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. An excelent place to stay in the evening near the fontain, to rest your feet after a long visiting day!
You can feel a typical turkish atmosphere.

Very busy at peak times but peaceful at others.. We had a lovely time sitting watching the world go buy. We also paid for a photograph (3L) which the man printed instantly and gave my partner a traditional hat to wear. Not something we would normally do but a funny novelty picture to take home with us.

Great way to relax. We sat down in the square after visiting the basilica cistern, the hagia Sophia and the blue mosque. It was quite nice we sat in the grass in the shade and just did people watching.
We also got to listen to the prayer and see the 'dialogue' between the blue mosque and the hagia Sophia. It was very interesting!

A true experience through old part of the city.... An amazing experience being in the very heart of the old city,this important square is the major destination for anybody visiting Istanbul.Sultanahmet Meydanı can not be described by the words only.You must walk down through its magnificient sources and try to get knowledge while analyzing the venue.
History wherever you turn. A great place to look around and take some pics. Expect a huge number of people walking about on black stoned streets.

Adds to the romance that is Istanbul. Beautiful to wander around and observe the gardens with the Haga Sofia on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. At night there are coloured lights in the fountains which illuminate the fountain and add to the fairytale effect.
Busy Square. There are hundreds of people in this square so if you enjoy people watching this is the place to go. You get a goid view of some of the great ild buildings as well or just chill out.
Great views if you can dodge the touts. It is so lovely jusr sitting half way between the Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque, if only you could enjoy the serenity. Nice spot for pictures.
Most happening place of Istanbul. Most happening and most fulfilling place at the heart of Istanbul. Everything important for tourists point of view is here so be there

Whirling Dervishes delight at the fountains in the square.... Nice transitional area between the two very famous sites of the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. I was especially taken by the mosaics of Whirling Dervishes at the main fountain as you look toward the Blue Mosque.
Stunning Place. We visieted here on our tour and the square is beautiful floweres in bloom tulips everywhere people evrywhere but easy to wander around take your time and smell the flowers

The heart of old Istanbul. This square is full of life and has great views on 2 of the main attractions of the city: Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. On a hot sunny day there may be a slight lack of shadow. It is also very close to the entrance of the Topkapi Palace. A must-visit spot when in Istanbul.

Tourist place in middle sultanahmet. What a lovely place to spend some time and watch the world go by.
Is between blue mosque and Hagia Sophia museum.
Tourist friendly

Nice place to relax and enjoy a coffee/ice cream however, it's unfortunately quite dirty. This place is a great place to relax after visiting Topki Palace, Hagia Sophia and/or Blue Mosque. The most amazing Hamam (turkish bath house) is also situated here as well. There are a couple of cafes/restaurants and ice cream stands in the area and a beautiful water fountain in the centre were tourists naturally flock towards but that's about it really. The area is let down by the copious amounts of trash and litter all across the streets and grassy areas. There seems to be a lack of trash cans. Chill, relax, people watch, enjoy an ice cream, the weather or watch the most friendliest cats approach you looking for you to pet or for you to feed them. This place is not a bad area.
in a stately neighborhood history. whichever way you turn, everywhere you feel and see history, beautiful place to rest and breathe with history

Enhanced my experience as a tourist in Sultanahmet. I bought donna kebabs for dinner and sat here on the benches, admiring The Blue Mosque and watching people sketch it. Very peaceful. There is no cover from the sun over the many benches during the day, which is good because there are plenty if places to sit. If you want the shade of a tree cross the road and tramline to another nice oark which has shade. One thing i really appreciated, was the abundance of seating while taking in the many sights. Istanbul have got this right, as I was here during peak tourist season, and it was about as hot as I wanted it to be. Pausing and resting is important and this place is part of that overall provision. Getting food and drink is also easy

It all happens here !. So much happening in this square. ....and it is ginormous! One could sit for hours just absorbing the atmosphere, the people, the diversity of cultures. Wander further into the gardens and enjoy all that is happening around the huge fountain pool.
Too busy and full of pushy salesmen. Tonnes of people and pushy salesmen - like flies.Nothing special at all. The only reason to go there is to visit the Blue Mosque.

Not much to do, but plenty to see. Bustling square filled with tourists. Lots of street food stands and people taking selfies. Not much to do here besides take your picture of the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque
Beautiful Area. This is a great spot to get wonderful exterior pictures of the Blue Mosque. Street vendors here if you want a snack.
Rest your feet. You can't miss it if you're planning on seeing the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia. Plenty of places to relax, dogs and cats to play with, and ice cream to be consumed.
good place to be for Iftar. just sitting and looking around at sunset, a short stroll to restaurants and cafes, the bread and roasted corn on the cob stalls are irresistible

COSMOPOLITAN & LIVELY!!. Vibrant heart of one of my favourite cities. A very cosmppolitan city and area with excellent public transport system and links - must get an ISTANBULKART (similar to OYSTER in London).
Nice historic area. the square full of nice cafe you can relax and pick Turkish tea or local ice cream .it is real turkey

blue mosque. We prayed there. Personally, i don't like masjid being decorated as this is against the prophetic tradition. However, if you are just talking about the artistic side, then the tiles, calligraphy, inlaid wood work, mimbar, chairs - the masjid is grand.There is a good bazar - Arasta bazar with blue mosque, the shop keepers are extremely decent, not pushy and tries to help instead of being imposing and nosy!
Beautiful respite. Gorgeous flowers, wonderful respite in the old part of Istanbul. Grab a bite to eat at a nearby restaurant and eat it here.

Heart of Istanbul. We pretty much walked past the Sultanahmet square every morning when we left our hotel and every evening when we got back to our hotel. Staying so close to this square was worth it. This square pretty much has all the historic sites in Istanbul. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Hippodrome and Arasta Bazaar. During the evenings we just hung out on many benches in the square to just soak it all in. The closest tram station is Sultanahment station which is served by T1 line. Blue Mosque is less than 3 mins walk from the station.
Beautifull with Aghia Sophia and Blue Mosque. You meet History and architecture.From one side Aghia Sophia and form the other Blue Mosque just amanzing.

Worth visiting. Quite cool, yet touristic but definitely worth checking out. Great place to chill as well, as you get the opportunity to people watch -- there's people from all walks of life roaming all over the place.
central tourist place. central area where many attractions are like the blue mosque, ayasofya, basilica cistern. This place is very busy and many tourists

Experience local culture. A great place to start your visit of Istanbul--Blue Mosque, undergroung cistern, hippodrome, and Hagia Sophia. Walking distance to grand bazaar and local restaurants. Accessible by street car Sultanamhmet Station.

A Must See place. One of the very few reasons to visit Istanbul is this Square. Infact one should aim to stay around the square in many of the hotel offerings. You haven't seen anything if you haven't been here. Not lots to do but one can sit around the grounds and admire the structures. The evenings give a better perspective with the lighting and all. At times there's even the night time light & sound show which takes you on a brief history tour. In the background is the Arasta Bazaar, not to be mistaken with the Grand Bazaar. On the other side of the tram tracks are loads and loads of restaurants offering mostly the same kind of food. You also find fastfood around.

Magnificent view. It is a great spot, but extremely crowdy, especially in the evenings and at nights. It is better to walk around early in the morning, when it is empty. The view of Aya Sofya and Mavi Camii is gorgeous.

Amazing experience. The sultanahmet square was a place we visited everyday while in istanbul as our hotel was round the corner. Our children used to love spending time here as the atmasphore is very vibrant. There are a lot of shops and food places around to keep you busy.

Busy Busy. This is the heart of the tourist area where all the main attractions are in Istanbul. It was the original area know as the Hippodrome of Constantinople. It is always busy with lots happening. It is close to lots of restaurants and we found it very safe to walk around at night. You can also get lots of photos of the Blue Mosque and Hagia sophia.

Just Lovely and relaxing. A very good place to relax especially during sunset. With a nice colored lightened pool in the center, you will have the chance to take nice photos for the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. during sunset.
Hearth of Istanbul. This is the hearth of Byzantium, Ottoman Empire and Istanbul. This is where all the attractions are. Saint Sophia Mosque, Byzantium Cistern, Blue Mosque and a lot more

Constantinople at Original. The excellent square in Istanbul with the most beautiful and renowned landmarks of the city. The whole area is lush with old and few new points of interest with lots of rush. Big city Bus also run from here from €25 for a round of city well so many things to do here.
Amazing history . Lovely square, with lots of old buildings and museums, rich culture, and lots of shops and restaurants to explore and enjoy,

Centre Square. This was the main square to stop at, with all main attractions within walking distance and most eateries every where.
Most beautiful in the night when lights brought magic and life in the miserable winter weather.
Heritage of the World!. If you come to istanbul you must see this place. This place has Topkapı Palace, Blue Mosque, Hipodrome, and many traditional restaurant and cafe.

Beautiful place. Beautiful place to enjoy during the day and under dark skies when both the Blue Mosque and Haga Sophia are beautifully lit and the circular fountains are in all their beauty changing colors dramatically. The whole place is buzzing at night and is a must see.

One of the oldest and most historic areas of Istanbul. With Hagia Sophia on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other, this is one of the most historic and oldest parts of Istanbul, It is busy day or night with both locals and tourists.
Beautiful . A nice place for a walk, especially at night when the weather cools down. It's a good spot to find street food vendors if you're at any of the surrounding sites.

Being in the very old part of the city!. An exciting experience for being in this very old and historical part of Istanbul.An excellent venue with heavy crowd day and night from any part of the world,a meeting and gathering spot for all international travellers.Here you can see some of the most important sights of the city.İf you are in Istanbul for pleasure,then yr trip agenda will led you to this true experience place in any case.Recommended.

Beautiful Square in the middle of Istanbul. What I liked most of all is a view of Hagia Sofya on one side and The Blue Mosque on a another - perfect combination. Especialy in the evening time when both buidlings are nicely illuminated. There are plenty of benches where you can relax & admire the beauty of the surroundings. Pay attention to a fountain which is in the middle of the square. There are exceptional mosaics around it.

A great night walk. Check out this area just before dark if your hotelis close ,the place looks great with all the lights , people and restaurants, not far from th e Bascillica cistern with has a great restaurant and light show. But it also has queues a lot of the time day and night.

Perfect relax in the middle of the city. Great to sit there on one of the benches and just see what´s going on :-) Ayasofya on one side and Sultahmet Mosque on the other side; mainly in the evening/night with amazing lighting.

Great place to sit and enjoy the view of the Blue Mosque on a sunny day!. On one side, Hagia Sophia.. on the other, Blue Mosque. The best views in the city. If it´s sunny, sit on a bench and enjoy the view eating one of the many treats sold at the square.
